description:
I got the seafood enchiladas and enjoyed the food! Despite the lackluster appearance, the food was comforting and hit the spot - kind of like the style of food you'd get if you go to a grandma or auntie's house. 

The restaurant got really busy around 11:30AM being in the FiDi. The salsa was pretty spicy with the pepper seeds! Service was quick and prompt, but I wish we had a refill on waters.
author: Bonnie S.

description:
Ate here for my lunch break! I ordered a carne asada super burrito with some chips and salsa. The burrito was good. 

What stood out to me was the cashier taking orders. She was super nice and we traded off jokes on our order. The food was quick! Before I even paid I got my order so if you're looking for a quick lunch this is the spot.
author: Brian L.

description:
1. I found a twig (or a chicken ribcage bone) in my burrito. 
2. The rice was so dry it tasted dehydrated and crunchy.

I wish they told me the chicken was shredded and not grilled, but that's my fault for assuming.

Also, idg why for the burrito it comes w rice and beans but it has to be served on the side. Couldn't they put it in the tortilla?
author: Phalicia C.

description: Best unlimited chips and top of the line garlic salsa. It's the best salsa anywhere. I love the ceviche tostada, carnitas plate or any burrito. The line gets long about noon so go a little earlier. The service is great. Highly recommend for work lunch.
author: Roy A.

description:
I ordered the Chicken Supremo ($9.25). When I first looked at the menu, I noticed there were two Chicken Supremos with different prices. I was told one was grilled and the other was shredded chicken. I ended up getting the grilled chicken which costed $1 more. 

The burrito tasted average and was filling. There was an average amount of meat and sour cream. Iceberg lettuce was used instead of romaine lettuce. I could not really taste the guacamole. Unfortunately, cheese was not included in the burrito. I believe vegetarian burritos include cheese though. 

I do not recommend getting mild salsa. It tasted like ketchup. 

I may come back in the future although I would probably choose other Mexican restaurants in the area over this one.
author: Kristina M.

description:
I've been coming here for almost 20 years. Fish taco's and original chimichanga are very good.
 It started to disappoint 2 years ago with deteriorating food, bad attitudes and sloppy service.   Today I ordered Tostada salad.  Instead of fresh tomatoes and sliced avocado as the menu states, it was some salsa and guacamole dumped over some old lettuce.  Won't be back.
author: mike m.

description: Orale Orale was a very solid Mexican restaurant to come to, especially in Fidi. If it were in the Mission, I would still stack it well. If you are looking for a quick bite downtown, or a good place to come on your lunch break Orale Orale should be at the top of the list. I have been here a couple of times, and they have great burritos, enchiladas, and great drinks on their happy hour menu.
author: Ross S.

description: I used to go to Orale Orale for lunch all the time until I moved away for a short period of time. My go to lunch was the chicken chimichanga. While my doctor may not like a fried burrito, I always found the quality of the shredded chicken, guacamole, and delicious salsa way better than other taquerias. Today after many years I did a MealPal and tried the chicken burrito supremo, and it was still delicious and still great quality. Even better, the staff was super friendly. I don't hand out 5 stars often, but Orale Orale has proven over the years to be consistently excellent.
author: Justin G.

description: This place has "decent" burritos and a staff that doesn't smile - ever. I ordered the taquitos the other day which were horrible. Soggy cold and flavorless. It was like they were fried the night before and placed in a holding pan without a heat lamp, absolutely horrible. This is the only burrito place in the area besides chipotle, i think. I use to eat at Orale Orale years and years ago and when I accepted a job across the street recently I was happy to try this place again. Sadly it's not worth it anymore.
author: Michele G.

description: decent Mexican food for a quicky takeaway place! Didn't have to wait long to order or get my food. That's an important measure in FiDi since there's hordes of people out during lunch-hour and I only get 30-minutes for lunch!
author: Dan N.

description:
Stopped by here out to the spur of the moment to ask to use their facilities, and I stayed and had the nachos (which were AMAZING!), chicken burrito and the El pastor burrito!
Very friendly staff that seems to know their usuals by name and greeted them like family . I'm glad I stopped in.
author: Janneth A.

description: I have gone to Orale Orale for many years, their food is consistently delicious and service is quick and friendly.  I also order food on MealPal recently, and the quality and portions are consistent with regular orders.  Excellent burritos, chimichangas, burrito bowls, etc. Happy Hour margaritas and tacos, quesadillas, etc are good.  The restaurant is family owned and in that location almost 30 years, always busy, speaks for itself!!
author: M D.

description: Nice local hangout place to meet friends for a drink or two and have appetizers.   We ordered chicken quesadilla, order of fish tacos and buffalo wings.   Service was great and the food was just ok.   I wouldn't come here just for food as there are other better options available.
author: Chet M.

description: My coworker, who is a regular here, took me for the first time and I ordered the chicken flautas.  Oh my gosh, so good!  I wish they gave more rather than 2, but It is really good and it comes with rice and beans.  In the past month, I've been here twice and I love it.  It's always busy and the staff is super friendly and very personable.
author: Rachel L.

description: Moving up a notch solely based on the Cali Supremo through MealPal.  It's the closest reminder to San Diego burrito style and packed nicely with meat.  Simple with only steak, guac, and French fries with side of salsa. Very satisfying.
author: Marc S.

description:
Decent place to eat.  I went there today and the rice was stale.

I'll make sure to go on a Tuesday in the future.

Thanks.
author: Blossssom M.

description: I ordered their seafood enchilada for the first time yesterday and it was good. I just hope that they would put more seafood (shrimps/scallops) in it. Thanks!
author: Tess P.

description: I ordered the tostada without sour cream or cheese to make it vegan. It was very simple but good. The restaurant was very busy. The chips were also good but the sauce was too spicy.
author: Shiva A.

description: Quick Mexican fare, super crowded place. Reasonable prices, good portion size and super quick service. We had the shrimp tacos and the casa asado supreme burrito. The food was alright I nothing much to talk about. The salsa they gave with the tortillas chips in the beginning was the highlight. If you are in the area I feel like there are so many other nicer places you can try for the same price point.
author: Nivedita S.

description:
It has been several months since my office moved a bit farther down Market Street, so I figured that now was the time to try to find a new Mexican spot in the area. Orale Orale was the first place I tried.

I was instantly skeptical of the fact that they charge for chips and salsa; $1.25 for chips, another $.30 if you want salsa to go with them. Typically, I've found that this is a sign of inauthenticity, but I was still willing to give them a shot.

I got a supremo vegetarian burrito, which cost me almost $11 including the aforementioned chips and salsa. I gotta say, that's pretty steep, but if it's good food, I was willing to give them a break.

Well, I am disappointed. A huge taqueria pet peeve for me is when the burrito is cold. The rice, beans, and other fillings were room temperature. The cheese was unmelted. It also lacked flavor; the rice was very bland, and I'm not sure if they even used salsa or pico de gallo - it tasted like diced tomatoes, which kinda reminded me of Taco Bell (sorry to have to go there, but it did).

I would have forgiven the surcharge for chips if they were the cripsy, thin, classic taqueria style chips, but instead, they tasted like chips out of a bag. The salsa, however, was very good. I will give them that.

Lastly, the burrito was on the smaller side. I should never be able to finish a proper burrito in a single sitting, and I scarfed this one down in its entirety, even accompanied by the subpar chips.

Hence, my search for a new favorite Mexican spot will have to continue...
author: Kelsey S.

description:
Came here as a sit down customer twice in a row. Yesterday I had the Chile Relleno, today the Chile Verde. The place is spartan, but the service is FAST and courteous, the prices right, and they have beer :)

Orale Orale is a very good alternative to the chains like Chipotle one block away in FiDi for lunch.

The food: It comes out within minutes of ordering, so you don't have time to stuff your face with the chips and salsa (which is very fresh and no doubt prepared the same day). Most platters come with yellow rice and refried beans, which are good enough, and the plates are superhot so your food stays hot throughout the meal.

The Chile Relleno was very good, and just cheesy enough. Today's Chile Verde was outstanding. The pulled pork chunks come apart with a fork they're so tender. Great gravy sauce too.

Yum
author: Massimo M.

description:
Awesome seafood selection. Great service. Delicious everything! Props to the cooks! 

This place is now on my list to frequently visits.
author: Roca P.

description:
My mom has been buying Orale Orale's burritos and bringing them home for ages. I've eaten the burritos fresh and I've eaten the burritos after a few hours of sitting around, and I can't quite figure it out, but I really enjoy them after they've been sitting around for a few hours. Maybe it's because the juices from the meat are soaked up in the tortilla....? Lol, I do not know. But I do enjoy their burritos. 

I always have the Carne Asada Supremo Burrito... (or is Burrito Supremo?). The burrito comes with carne asada, rice, beans, lettuce, tomato, green onions, sour cream, and guac. I've tried coming here for lunch and had my burrito fresh and for some reason the meat is just not as flavorful. But still pretty good. I really like how you can taste the guac, which always tastes pretty fresh and I do like how they add green onions to their burritos. It makes the burrito different than the typical burrito. But their salsa is the absolute best! It's pretty spicy compared to other places I have been to. I would totally go here just to get the chips and salsa. I've also tried the breakfast burrito, which was okay. But that was probably my bad since I got the one with scrambled eggs, potatoes, rice, and beans. Pretty basic, nothing special. I'm sure the other breakfast burritos on their menu are more exciting.

The place is fairly busy during lunch, so I suggest coming before the madness. I have had to wait for a while each time I've tried ordering at the counter for take-out. And sometimes I wish I got a little more salsa since I do like using salsa on every bite. I don't get any chips when I get my order to go, and I'm not sure if there is a minimum for that or what, but I do know that you get some if you dine-in. Anyway, the burrito is pretty solid. My friend enjoys the quesadilla, so maybe I'll give that a try next time.
author: Meghan J.

description:
Pleasantly surprised by this place. I've walked by dozens of times in FiDi but never given it any thought until my friend was craving Mexican food and his regular place was closed. 

We made it in for an early lunch but a good amount of tables were already taken. This place isn't too big or too small, and has a casual cozy vibe. We were seated right away with chips and salsa ready to go on the table. 

I ordered the two carne asada taco combo, the bf got chicken tacos and my friend went with the enchiladas. General consensus was that it's fresh, tasty, and filling. The rice and beans are definitely negligible, but the carne asada was pretty close to perfect. Also, they're really flexible about customizing your toppings which is always appreciated. 

The best part about this place was the service. The father and son who were running the restaurant were incredibly attentive and sweet - even after it got insanely packed towards the end of our meal. Will definitely keep this place in mind for a good FiDi lunch.
author: Kate K.

description: I had a burrito here for lunch and then my stomach hurt for two days :( but this place is always crowded so some people must like it ‍
author: Jenna C.

description: Yes, I'm a fan. This place has been my go-to since I've worked at Embarcadero Three. It's extremely FAST and the salsa is great (not hot, great flavor). I highly recommend Orale Orale, especially their crispy chicken tacos. They do have breakfast burritos with chorizo, but it's not spicy at all and I don't really like my breakfast burritos with lettuce, so I ask them not to include it. GO!
author: Deb B.

description:
First bite I took i thought I was eating Taco Bell. This is probably what Taco Bell should aspire to be if that makes sense... salsa was weak, burrito was average but large... 

SF has so many great Mexican spots - doesn't make much sense to go here unless you're on a super tight budget or something? 

Head to the mission and just about every spot beats this one. 

Good location, mediocre food, good price, better options nearby.
author: Eric S.

description:
Located on the same city block as Chipotle and Taco Bell, this is a solid FiDi option for Mexican (and Tex-Mex) cuisine.  Obviously not as good as well-known Mission staples, but a safe bet for lunch downtown.  Heck, it's not uncommon to see some office workers sneak a Margarita or Tecate when dining in.

Beef & Pork Chimichanga: Better than I expected.  A nice mix of ground beef and pork cubes for good meat texture contrast.  Some veggies mixed in like grilled peppers and maybe even lettuce.  Topped with a dollop of sour cream and guacamole.  It felt like just the right portion of deep fried burrito to be satisfying, but not to over stuff you and make you feel gross.  I like that the tortilla was fried on the outside but still a little soft on the inside so it didn't feel overly deep fried.

Beans & Rice: Pretty standard refried beans and yellow rice.  Complemented the main dish, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat just these.

Nachos & Salsa: The salsa definitely tasted like it was made earlier in the day rather than a few days back.  I could tell because the cilantro was nice and crisp.  Also, a decent pepper kick.  It's a good thing my main dish came out quickly so I didn't fill up on these.
author: Adam B.

description: Great lunch but really love the breakfast plates and juevos rancheros is the best in town for me. Lunch line is usual but worth it and the baby burritos to go are a favorite and I get a few to take home they are so good.  highly recommend, they are in financial district across from Embarcadero 3
author: Sam B.

description: Service is quick which is greatly appreciated, and all of the servers are pretty friendly. I have tried a few things on the menu, and everything is ok. The free chips and salsa are rather bland.
author: Lisa H.

description: Pretty good for a quick lunch stop. The line was pretty long, but it went by quickly. I ordered the carne asada burrito bowl. Overall, it was a bit bland and overcooked, but it was satisfying for what it was. I would come back for a quick bite, but I wouldn't expect anything special.
author: Cynthia M.

description:
exceptionally rude counter person...
i've dealt with her before.
the food is mediocre and not worth dealing with such and unhappy and rude person.  wont be back.
author: Ripley B.

description: I went here to meet a friend for lunch. It was surprisingly very good. Everything seemed fresh and the carnitas Burrito is had was delicious. The flavor was all there and the service was on point.
author: Helen Y.

description:
My friend wanted Mexican food for lunch and he suggested Orale Orale. I try to avoid heavy meals that will put me in a food coma but I figured, what the heck, I'll try a new spot. We arrived at 11:55am on a Friday and we ended up waiting about 20 minutes to get seated. There was a separate line for takeout orders but we didn't want to rush our meal so we waited.

I ordered the Crab Enchilada, which apparently is a Friday special. I grew up eating the Crab Enchiladas at Fiesta Del Mar in Mountain View and I didn't expect Orale Orale's version to be like that but this version was pretty terrible. They were small and simply smothered in sauce. The enchiladas probably would've tasted the same even if they weren't crab since the flavors were so masked by the sauce. Presentation-wise, it was also not attractive.

I know, this is a hole-in-the-wall. I love Mexican food but Orale Orale just doesn't do it for me.
author: Yi Z.

description:
Affordable and awesome Mexican lunch in Fidi. Most people do takeout which is much faster and a lot more convenient. Expect a short wait if you have a large party, or avoid the lunch crowd and go slightly later.

The fajita is absolutely delicious. Highly recommended!
author: Christina N.

description:
I like this place. The food is good. The margaritas are good. And the service is great. 

I come here after work sometimes with my co-workers for their margaritas. The only thing is that they close at 8:00pm and we get off at 7:00pm so we feel rushed sometimes. But it's ok. 

This place is Always busy during lunch time and after work for those people who get the regular 9-5. 

I will still come back here for the steak taquitos and margaritas any day.
author: Edie G.

description:
Ordered food to go but buddy and I decided there's a few open tables so why not sit and enjoy their food.  Owner (I think) won't allow us to sit even after we we're patiently waiting in line. He would have to charge us for a table. It's Holidays so no point making a fuss with so many A-holes in the world so we walked out.

Just beware there's an A-hole here.  I'm not a regular but been here a few dozen times.

(4 star for food, -3 for the A-hole = 1 star)
author: Sum W.

description:
My former co-worker first introduced me to Orale Orale with the seafood burrito.  I had never seen a burrito so huge in my life that it did not take long to get addicted to it and the crab enchiladas that were available on Fridays only.  Lunch can be very busy so it is best to get it to go unless you are working the day after Thanksgiving, then you will get a seat without the wait or go after work for a quick dinner and/or its happy hour specials.  

Decades later, it is still reasonably priced and with the basket of chips and salsa, you will walk away full and happy.
author: Joyce Z.

description: The Owner is petty enough to charge for a simple lemon slice at the rate of $1:00 even when I already spent $10.00 for a burrito. IT SHOULD COME WITH THE BURRITTO! Keep your Bad Salsa and give me the lemon! The petty charge cost you 2 stars and a chip on the shoulder. No pun intended. Salsa makes me scratch my head bc they put in so much effort to give you them yet they don't come with chips. Never seen shit like this in my life. They where secretly charging me for a simple lemon slide until I asked.
author: Marcos E.

description:
I thought the food was quite terrible, my enchilada sauce was basically ketchup. Everything is quite misleading - the menu on the wall shows different prices than the menu they provide to you.  Then they advertised a glass of wine for $2.75 on their happy hour menu, then it was $3.00 on my check.  I'm guessing it's because it's easier to add, since they use paper checks and not a computer POS system, but still.

All that aside, I have to give stars because everyone is SO friendly and wonderful.  As in, I would give the place negative stars but they were so stinkin' delightful they managed to pull three stars out of me instead.  Food came out quick, smiles were genuine, they said hi to everyone and interacted nicely.  It's hard to come by such personable service in the Financial District where everyone is so stuffy and demanding.

I will come again when I need cheap drinks and want to avoid the busier happy hour spots.
author: Jessika S.

description: I'm surprised this place doesn't have more stars! I was so happy to discover it on MealPal. The burritos are great and the service is prompt. I've brought a few coworkers here when the line at Chipotle around the corner was too long. I always get the vegetarian burrito with chips and salsa and it never disappoints.
author: Allegra G.

description: Chips were stale and the seafood enchiladas tasted like clam chowder enchiladas and not in a good way.  Staff was friendly and helpful but the food was disappointing.  My co-worker had bought a burrito here randomly before and liked it so we thought we would try other menu items.  Today he had the chicken Verde enchiladas and didn't care for it either.   I guess only the burritos are decent here.
author: Carolyn O.

description:
This was our first time here.  We've passed by it many times but never made it in because of the crowds.  Today we made a conscious effort to eat here and made sure we were there by 11:30.  If you're not there by 11:30, be prepared to wait.  It gets very crowded during the lunch rush.

The man who greeted us was very friendly and the food was great.  My son and I both had Carnitas... his in the form of a Burrito and mine in the form of a Chimichanga. The salsa was amazing, would love to have a jar of that in the frigde at home, very fresh with the right amount of kick.

The friendly man who greeted us later introduced himself as Alex.  He took the time to ask my name and shake my hand.  We told him it was our first time and how good our food was.  He took a moment to chat and tell us the history of the place.  The service was outstanding, mainly because of him.  Our server wasn't the friendliest woman, but Alex more than made up for it.

We'll definitely be back.  They've got some new regulars.
author: Bobbie T.

description:
There was no line at 11.30 am cool. Cashier is smiling even better. That's about it.
Got the food, nachos with chicken and guacamole and sour cream. 
You are given a closed plate to go so you get the surprise when you arrive in the office. I swear to god I had like 15 chips in the plate, which were swimming in some watery juice. 
Will never go back. Paid $12 I am still starving. Total FAIL
author: Carpe D.

description: Had the burrito supremo - it was ok. Lots of beans and rice, not much meat, sour cream, etc. Flavor was blah.
author: Alex S.

description: I'm giving this place 4 stars based on my overall experience of coming here for many years. It is one of my favorite mexican restaurants with good food and friendly family staff. My favorite items are the Burrito Supremo (any meat). I've tried them all. The carnitas is an extra charge. I also like the chicken verde enchiladas plate. They have really good refried beans topped w/ cheese and their spanish rice is colorful and flavorful. The place is tiny and always busy for lunch. Arrive early by 11:30am or after 2pm for no wait dining. I call in my order more often than dining in. I ordered crispy beef tacos the last time and I was so craving crispy that day only to discover soggy soft corn tortilla tacos when I got back to work (wrong item). I was very disappointed. Today I ordered a chicken burrito supremo which was on the smaller side and not as flavorful as usual. I finished and I'm still hungry which shouldn't happen after you order a $9 supreme burrito. It was more of a veggie burrito today with not as much chicken and the rice I love. Hopefully next time they'll be better! I have high hopes though as they've given me a good food buzz more often than not!
author: Shannon T.

description:
Bill was 9.89. Instead of charging me their minimum 10.00 card charge they charged me a 1.00 fee on top for a total of 10.89. 

Ordered steak burrito got pork.
author: Matt M.

description: nice little authentic Mexican by the Hyatt and Embarcadero Center. it's inexpensive and quick service at lunch. they have $3 wine happy hour (I think it starts at 3pm) which is a terrific bargain. besides the typical tacos, burritos and enchiladas, they have some specialty plates which are great.
author: Bob U.

description: Honestly maybe one of the west supreme burritos I've ever had. Assembly line style, meet was cold and sparse. Just bad.
author: thekidd b.

description: The best staff and owners!!! Family owned joint that strives to make u feel like family from the second you walk in. This kind of neighborhood place is the blood of San Francisco that has to be protected fiercely. The food is amazing. The meat is moist and crispy, the tortillas fresh, and the rice and beans are superb. I come to this place for the people but the fact that their food is killer and I get to support a local family business that's has been around since before the tech boom makes it more than ideal. Orale!  Come eat here and spend your hard earned money and say hi to Alex and Danny the Jefes. Thanks for the grub.
author: Brian P.

description:
Yum yum yummmmmmm. Love this place. Every time I come here, it's always delicious. Decided to make an update since I tried another delicious item!

Got the Seafood Supremo the other day and it was so good! They were quick to make it. Took like 2-3 minutes. That sauce on the burrito was delicious as well. The aroma just makes your mouth water. Now it may sound weird that there is sauce on top of the burrito, but just try it! 

Now I have 3 favorites: Pork Quesadilla, Chicken Chimichanga, and Seafood Supremo. Can't wait to try everything on the menu!!
author: Benita M.

description: If you can find any seafood in this seafood burrito....your lying. One shrimp at open end of burrito......RIPOFF.....The place and the food stinks!!!
author: Larry D.

description: This place is always packed for lunch. Need to be there by 11:30am to get a table or else you will need to wait in a long line. Food is average, and I always feel somewhat rushed because they try to turnover the table quickly for other customers.
author: Mirana Y.

description: This guy that works here doesn't understand the idea of service.  When I spend my money I expect it. Awful service. He has a lot of negative attitude- if you go there, be warned.  $2.50 for a can of Coke.  The food is awful too.  Don't spend a dime here.  Will be closed within a year I'm sure- that's where the attitude comes from.  I won't be coming back.  Neither should anyone. I wish I could give 0 stars.
author: Patrick S.

description:
This place was a waste of my lunch hour.

They seemed pretty friendly and I have no complaints about the servers. The food though..perhaps I am too spoiled by the options we have in the SF Bay Area. In the future, I think I'll save myself for the Mission area, or Uno Dos Taco, if I want to stay in the Financial District.

Anyway, the shrimp tacos were BLAND; the shrimp itself tasted boiled, overcooked and not seasoned at all. I had one bite of one taco and asked my bf to taste it too, to confirm it wasnt good. I tasted the black beans (okay) and rice (dry, tasteless). The server came by when she saw I wasn't eating any longer and asked me if I wanted to wrap it up to go. I said it was not very good, and asked if it could get taken off the check, gven I hadn't eaten 90% of it. Some guy comes over and says he will charge me for 1 taco since "you ate it". Hmmm okay. Ive never had a restaurant (not even the one I worked at) nickel and dime me on subpar food, especially when it's all still on the plate.

Moving on, they took 3 dollars off the bill. The math does not work out, but I didn't really want to argue about it or wait any longer, so suffice to say, we will not come here again or recommend anyone else to. $40 for two drinks, 1 taco (yea, sure) and enchilada plate PLUS the price of my actual lunch. Waste of money and time.
author: Jameace M.

description: Just OK...  Very average in my opinion.  The steak in my burrito lacked flavor and the chips were just "eh" at best.  The service wasn't the best either, but whatever.  This is kind of a hole in the wall place and there seem to be a few regulars in there.
author: Matt H.

description:
Huevos Machaca!! Every payday!!  And then some other days!
Alex rulz.
author: K'ra L.

description:
Good food and service but not close to great. Burritos are often lukewarm to cold, especially the unmelted cheese. 

I'm guessing the kitchen is in a GREAT HURRY to get food out, ready or not...

Could be much better.
author: Oscar C.

description: I have tried this place on two separate occasions.  Both time I have ordered a Carne asada super burrito and both times the rice had a curry taste to it and both had lettuce in my burrito. Lettuce does not belong in a burrito. Those things are called wraps! Not a fan! I will continue to walk the extra time to Caramba to get my burrito fix.
author: Kyle W.

description: extremely average mexican food. went here mainly for drinks on the way to the exploratorium at night, but there are dozens of far better places for mexican in the city. margaritas were good - i had mango and my friends had strawberry - but EXPENSIVE ($8) for how small they were. would definitely try harder to make it by happy hour for cheaper drinks next time.
author: Ellen G.

description: Yeah I can't tell why this place only has 3.5 stars. I was visiting from Austin and stopped here for lunch during a conference nearby. I got the surf & turf burrito and was floored. It was SO good. I sat on a nearby bench and just kept eating until I was stupid full. I'd recommend it for sure. Only thing is that has already been mentioned before: there was a very minimal wait during lunch with not a lot of standing room but the service and the food definitely made up for it. I'll def stop back in next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Clay C.

description:
I was super hungry and someone took me here . Ordered the carne Asada supremo and oh boy was it a miss. The meat was so dry and chewy and it had no flavor . 

It was so hard to scarf down , I Had to throw almost half away . Urgggg
author: Nhung T.

description: I ordered their burritos twice and personally, I am not a big fan. The burrito was kind of bland and dry, not enough flavor and nothing too special about it. However their chips and salsa are pretty good and I do know of people who enjoy eating here, so I'll give it three stars :) however I personally would prefer to get my burritos somewhere else in the area instead.
author: Bailey L.

description:
"The signs are there for a reason!" That's the last jarring line I heard from the oaf behind the counter as I hurried out of this debacle. A co-worker and I were feeling some Mexican food and this was the closest thing to a cantina we could find online. We went and ordered a burrito and an enchilada plate. I look for a table. Apparently this place runs separate registers for dine-in and to-go, although we were never asked anything of the sort. 

"Hey!" he barks, "You have to wait over there for a table" and gestures to the same area in which we stood while ordering food. Awkwardly we spin around and try to intermingle with the crowd still ordering. Three tables are open and set-up, with no other parties in the jumble of patrons seemingly waiting. "Would it be okay if we sit here?" I ask a busboy. "You can't eat here!" Mr. Oaf toss in. I'm surprised he's still listening, but it seems like we are his new hobby. "We already ordered" my friend responds, "now we are just waiting or a table." 

"You ordered to-go, you can't eat here. There are two separate sides, the signs are there for a reason!"

Bemused, confused, ultimately pissed off, i wait for him to call our number, grab our sub-par food, and gear back into the cold winter streets. 

P.S. the carne asada burrito: steak tastes okay, but it was mostly bland avocado mash and super wet beans. Souper-wet. I've had pho with less juice than this burrito. Not delicious steak grease mixed in with the salsa. Just weird, undrained bean juice. Gross. 

And they put lettuce in their breakfast burritos. Wtf. 

To the oaf: you're a jerk and that was completely unnecessary.
author: Nick K.

description: I paid $9 for nachos that were worth one-third as much. Bland salsa, small portion, store-bought guac. I won't be going back!
author: Michael B.

description:
Hmmmmm. Not bad, not bad. Definitely could've been better I have high standards because I'm from LA where the Mexican food tends to be a bit more authentic (in my experience) . 

REASON: 
I came here for a really early lunch just to meet and chat with someone from my company. And wanted to eat somewhere close by. His suggestion was this Mexican place. 

FOOD: 
Supreme burrito. There's something lacking here. If it wasn't for the burrito doused in sauce it would've been quite a plain burrito. Ton of beans. No guac. Pretty huge burrito. Served on cheap colorful plates. You've got to use a knife and fork to eat it with because it's pretty much a wet burrito. Come here when you're hungry, you get GIGANTIC portions. Probably best to call in your order or get it to go. 

SERVICE: 
Asked us what we wanted to drink right when we sat down. However, we didn't know if we were supposed to seat ourselves or ask for a table. So we stood there dumbfounded for a minute before someone told us that we could sit anywhere. I think it's seat yourself if there's no one there, and wait in line if there's a ton of people there. 

AMBIANCE: 
You got your mom and pop looking place. With a bunch of wooden old school tables and checkered table clothes with glass on top. 

TIP: the best time to go during the weekdays is before 11:30. I came at 11, and there were about two tables taken. But as I was leaving around 12. The line was OUT the door. ALL the tables were taken.
author: Tiffany J.

description:
Just finished inhaling my food and all I can say is... whoa.

We have a collection of menus at work, and Orale Orale's was in the pile. My coworker said good things about the baby burrito, saying it was sizable even for being the smallest burrito you can order. 

Placed a phone order for pick up and asked them to hold the rice and add guacamole and salsa, and the very nice lady on the phone said it would be ready in less than five minutes. 

Immediately after hanging up I went downstairs and down the block and when I walked in my burrito was already ready. Taking it back to the lunchroom in my building and unwrapping it, I was surprised by how generous of a burrito it really is. For only $4.25 you get a ton of meat (I ordered the chicken) and ingredients - but this is definitely as messy as it gets. Multiple-napkins-required messy. And I reveled in every bite.

The chicken was flavored wonderfully, and the salsa and guacamole combined with the pinto beans made this an incredibly delicious, cheap dinner. With the added toppings and a can of soda my total came out to $7.30. I'm still savoring the flavors left behind. My menial complaint: not enough guacamole. It was definitely there, but there wasn't quite enough for the whole burrito.

Seriously one of the best burritos I've ever had, and it's a fantastic deal that left me full but not stuffed. I'll be coming back regularly!
author: Angela M.

description: I had the regular taco, and it was just alright. It's too over price for just a "regular taco" wasn't full at all.
author: Marisa F.

description:
This is a really cool Mexican food joint that has a great environment! When you walk in, it has that crazy, loud, and all over the place vibe! Its small so don't expect to come here with a large group! 

The one thing I didn't like was the heat! IT WAS SO HOT! The tiny restaurant with the amount of people waiting for a seat and food being cooked was not a good combo! 

The food was pretty good! I ordered the pasedor tacos! It's a hefty meal! It comes with rice and beans on the side so don't think ordering tacos is JUST the tacos! 

Grab a friend and enjoy :)
author: Sabrina L.

description: I came here on a whim with my coworkers. We went on a Friday afternoon around 11:45a. There were plenty of tables, but by 12p the restaurant was a full house. I had no idea that this place even existed. But now I'm glad, I'm going to stop by more often. I had the Carne Asada Fries, which were surprisingly very good. Loads of meat, guacamole, and sour cream. But seriously, who could mess up fries? Service was prompt, but not super friendly. And I love that we got our chips refilled without asking.
author: Jeanne C.

description: This place is really good. The chili Quiles with Carnitas is amazing. The staff is very friendly.  It's also family owned and operated.
author: Eric M.

description: Lunch to go on a Friday found me back here once again. The super friendly people who work here are amazing. I ordered the chicken chimichanga which was very good and moist. Probably 1/3 chicken all white meat. Yum. He salsa was just hot and spicy enough for my taste buds to pop and say thanks. So skip the lines and diarrhea from Chipotle's and get into one of the FiDi's hidden gems. I'm typing this back at my desk with a smile on my face.
author: Ed C.

description: Great customer service and take-out service, I have been pleased with everything I have ordered. It's been hard finding food I have enjoyed In the financial district. Great authentic Mexican food prices are also responsible.
author: P W.

description: To be honest, I dont like it. The chicken wings were toooo salty.
author: 蕾蕾

description:
Probably the best Mexican spot in FiDi.  Happy Hour is great there too!!  It's from 5-7pm.  Huge plus that they have some select hard liquor to get your drank on!!  

Got the bean dip, tacos (chicken, carne, carnitas), guac, hella orders of their chicken wings (bomb.com), and flautas to share with the girls last night.  They come here often after work but this was my first time.  Got some dranks too..  

Service here is great!  Everyone was super friendly and helpful even though the place was packed.  

I recommend coming here if you're in the area and craving Mexican food!
author: Vicky T.

description: This place was awesome, me and the roommate were just aimlessly walking around, starving when we stopped because the smell coming from this place just enchanted us to walk in. Before you knew it I had a plate of chilaques in front of me. Which was immediately scarfed down. The food was great, the server was cute and the salsa was just spicy enough.
author: Evelyn Vanessa A.

description:
Breakfast Burrito:
- Rice
- Beans
- Rice
- A little lettuce
- Rice
- Tablespoon of chorizo
- Rice
- Is that egg?
- Rice

Honestly the worst burrito, breakfast or not, that I have ever had.
author: Seamus H.

description:
We 'yelped' a Mexican food restaraunt while down near Ferry Building and found this gem. We loved it so much we went back again and next time we're down there and craving Mexican food we will go back. We loved everything about it! The chips, salsas, food, service and atmosphere. A true little 'hole in the wall' Mexican food joint only a heck of a lot cleaner than those other 'hole in the wall' places :) 
I thought the salsa was a bit hot but my husband LOVED it and when I asked if they had milder salsa they happily brought out some pico that was the bomb. So, two times there, four different plates ordered and we loved every one of them.
author: Sharon S.

description: Truly the best eating experience of our trip there to the city. After a long day of sightseeing and having no clue where to eat, we stumbled across this place like an oasis in the desert. Haha :) The guy with the beard was hands down one of the best persons I've ever encountered in a restaurant. This place is now a must stop for our next trip there. The surf and turf was the best I've had and unmatched here in San Diego.
author: Mike V.

description:
This is one of my favorite places to come for Mexican food in the financial district. Beware the line can get out of hand and there is always a wait, but if you're eating in it doesn't too long to get a table. 
The burritos here are huge! big portions and tasty. I really like the carne asada fries, the fried taquitos, and the enchiladas.
author: Irma R.

description: Don't even bother with this place. The burrito is not good. I ordered a supremo and it looks like a regular size to me. The meat was bland. Where's the seasoning?! The salsa kinda helped but it wasn't the greatest salsa I had.  And this place doesn't even give out free chips! Seriously?! I'm paying $14 for a burrito and there's no chips? Only free chips if you eat in. No salsa bar either. Lame
author: Ann L.

description:
The ingredients tasted fresh and fine, that wasn't the problem. 

However, their portion sizes were paltry and that was disappointing.

I got the carne asada supremo bowl and literally less than 1/3 of the take out container was actually filled with food. 

The halal truck two blocks away fills the same container to the brim with food.
author: Jenny L.

description: Warning: This is not fine dining.  However, it is a good lunch place if you work at or near the Embarcadero Center.  I've been going here for over 20 years.  Affordable food and quick service.  They turn tables quickly at lunch, so this isn't the place to go if you want to linger over conversation after your meal.  There is usually a line out the door, so they'll ask you for your table.  I've seen some comments about the portion sizes and my response is "really?!"  I think the portion sizes are generous and I really like that they have a baby burrito (the super is pretty big).  I like the nachos, quesadilla, burriotos, enchiladas.  Free chips and salsa (the salsa, which is pretty spicy, I often ask for some mild and mix together).
author: Donna G.

description: My $9+ veggie burrito consisted of beans, rice, cheese, and a drop of guac. By itself its a largely bland affair but thank goodness they pack a small plastic container of salsa which is fairly good.  I can name three taquerias in the Fidi that offer similar burritos for $6.
author: Bigfrog W.

description:
17 year customer will never go back.

I've been a happy customer of Orale Orale for 16 or 17 years, but I will never go back.  I'll try to keep this brief as I will not be wasting any of my time or thoughts on this place ever again.

Ate there with my family last week and had the WORST service I've ever experienced anywhere.  To be fair, my wife did have the audacity to ask the server (who I believe is one of the managers/owners) if he could check on our food (we'd been waiting for about 15 minutes and, if you've ever been here, you know they move you through fast).  The manager barely glanced at her and said, "Yeah, it's coming up" as he pointed to the kitchen.  It went downhill from there.

My wife ordered the grilled tilapia and it came out dry (obviously cooked too long).  When she commented to the  server that it was dry he didn't miss a step as he flew past our table - he said, "put some lime on it..." in a voice that left no doubt that he was irritated and didn't have time or patience for his customer.  My burrito was hardly better (and I have always loved the food here).

The manager who was obviously miffed at us never came back, but as we were preparing to leave, my wife did stop him to say that the fish was the worst she had ever had (since he never stopped to ask how the food was, or if there was anything else we wanted, she had to bring it up to him).  Now, I can understand that he might not like hearing this, but that's no excuse for what ensued.  He launched into a ridiculous defense of the poor preparation, indicating that she shouldn't expect grilled fish to be moist (really?  Um, we've had plenty of grilled fish and, if cooked properly, it should be moist).  He argued with her until she said, "I'm the customer and you shouldn't treat customers like this!" He ended up shouting at both her and my son and insulted us before storming off.

I don't care how good the food and service has been in the past, I will never be going back.  Small loss to them, I know: they have a line out the door, but if I had built up a business over so many years, I'd be utterly disappointed to have someone like that trash my reputation.
author: Lance C.

description: I've been eating at Orale for at least 15 years.  I love that it's family owned and Alex is the best!  Quality, price and service are 5 stars.  They make the best salsa ever.  But today I went and they changed their chips and their crunchy taco shells.  Sorry but Yuck!  Bring back the old chips and go back to the old taco shells por favor!
author: Val M.

description:
So my husband and I were looking for a "local" Mexican food place to have our usual Friday night Mexican dinner... we checked this place out and from the time we walked in until we left we were treated like family... as if we had been coming here since the day they opened! 

Such friendly people and the food?! Omg so so good! We have been to so many Mexican food restaurants and they just can't seem to get things right... but these guys are awesome! The server is so friendly and fun. She asked chef to grill my tilapia for my fish tacos and they were delicious.

Hubby had his "meat & cheese only" burrito and she had chef grill it to melt the cheese w/out us asking. Such great service. It's the small things that are Big!

And the salsa? Well, it made me sweat and was the best but, nothing a beer bucket couldn't fix! 

We will be telling friends and family to check this place out for "local" Mexican food and atmosphere!

We suggest you do the same... very very delicious!
author: Dar G.

description:
It was between 3 or 4 stars for me, but seeing as they are open for dinner, that pushed it over the edge to its final 4 stars.  Trying to find a sit-down place in the embarcadero for dinner that isn't $$$ is quite frustrating.

I couldn't decide whether to get the enchiladas or the enchiladas verdes, so when I asked him for a recommendation, he said I could have one of each. So I ended up getting one pork and one chicken while I was at it.  I think they might have charged me more for it, however, because even with a ten percent tax, the bill came out to more than expected.

Also, I agree that the service is a little meh.  I kept running out of water which is always annoying, but ultimately not a huge deal breaker.
author: Alison L.

description: I remember it as being good and generous in the distant past but not so much anymore.  I've noticed that a lot of Mexican restaurants are charging more, nickel and diming for things that used to come free with the order (salsa, chips).  It's pretty much in line with standard $12-15 for lunch in SF but for inexpensive ingredients such as rice and beans (and not organic for what that's worth).  Better to  spend the megabucks on the fancy, organic salad place!
author: Nancy T.

description: I try to make it here once a month for the crab enchilada. They only have the crab on Fridays. All the food is exceptional and the prices are very reasonable. I live In the east bay but this place is just a 5 minute walk from Embarcadero Bart station. Definitely worth the trip. If you like margaritas, try the cucumber and jalapeño margarita, they make the best combination. My wife is a big fan of the surf & turf burrito, she has been coming here for over 20 years
author: Carlton D.

description: L O V E this place! The chips and salsa are amazing, and everything on the menu is delicious. Stiff margaritas, too! What more can I ask for?
author: Sunha L.

description:
I usually call in my order for a super burrito chicken no salsa no sour cream on the phone and wait only 2mins or so to pick up my order. 

They do charge for chips but the kind man who is tall and big lets me slide since I only ask for 6 pieces of chips with no salsa to chew as I go back to work. Since I'm a regular and come often. 

It gets really packed in the financial district during lunch time. So if you don't come in before 12, it's a little tough to get a seat. But for those on the go, they have a fast ordering and pick up line on the right part of the restaurant where they handle you real quick. 

I only tried their burrito, and I only stick to the same burritos order. Their rice are really good it's like a yellowish color and the chicken meat is shredded that looks like string cheese. The beans are cooked pretty good and doesn't taste over cooked. 

The cashier are nice and the big guy next to her is kind to me when I pick up my order. Keep up the good work. 

-1 star for no extra seating if you want to dine in. Maybe make a top floor or make some tables outside? But overall 5/5 if I can seat down sometimes. cheers!
author: Ken S.

description: This was the first time I've been to this restaurant. I went on Friday forgetting it was Cinco de Mayo. My husband and I walked past during lunch and it was extremely busy so we decided to come back for dinner. We got there right on time around 6 and was already busy and a line was starting. The atmosphere was fun and our waitress Jayla was extremely nice and attentive towards us during our whole dinner. For the restaurant to be so busy you would think there would be more than two servers helping the tables! The other server was a guy with a beard named Alex. These two were the up most genuine people we have met in a long time. They gave us a great experience even with it being super packed in there. It was amazing watching them work as if they already knew what one was thinking! Small business like these make such a great impact! We will be back soon!
author: Sharon W.

description: Great sit down lunch spot in Financial District - food is really good and affordable, chips and salsa on every table when you sit down, staff is friendly too. Go on the early side (before 1145) to avoid the crowd!
author: Ken R.

description: Mediocre at best. I've eaten there twice, had it at a catered event, and I've tried a variety of their menu items including egg items, tacos, and enchiladas. Everything fell flat. Their food has no flavor at all. Their salsa is completely tasteless, not spicy, and their guacamole is super bland (almost fake). I hear their margaritas are good, but I won't be spending any more money on food there.
author: Ana C.

description: Anybody rating these guys less is either crazy or doing it wrong....I've been coming year for 8 years and never had a bad experience.  Best service, carnitas and enchiladas around.  Even if there is a wait for a table, Alex and company always have me eating within 5-10 minutes of getting seated.
author: Adam D.

description: Great service. I was $0.17 short on my order because I forgot my wallet.  They said don't worry about it instead of making me walk back to my office. That's great and unexpected service!
author: Luke A.

description:
Not a ton of ambiance and the food is average.
The prices are great and the happy hour is amazing.
So come for a marg or a beer after work. Enjoy some chips and salsa. Be happy you spent under $10 for drinks.
author: Adrienne G.

description:
A friend and I both had the enchiladas here and both of us ended up with some sort of stomach issue. She had stomach cramps and I felt nauseous afterwards. 

This place is definitely a little overpriced for your classic greasy Mexican food. But for those of us who are too lazy to spend an extra 15 minutes making our way to the Mission, this is what we get. Sub par, overpriced burritos/enchiladas/tacos sitting in a pool of liquid-y beans, yum.

The upside? Service was friendly and the meal tasted good in that junk-food-grease-heavy kind of way while we were eating it. It's just the aftermath that might be a little more unpleasant. I hate to seem hypocritical but having said all of that, I have an inkling that I'll be back here. The happy hour prices are a steal for FiDi and it's conveniently located for grab-and-go meals.
author: Junes S.

description: Just popped in this am.  Had an awesome breakfast burrito for $8 for take out.  Definitely will be back.
author: Matt M.

description: I'm guessing my experience was so bad because I went in an hour before close.  The staff was nice however, stated they couldn't make anything fried(fryers off, hoods being clean shortly). So I opted for there supremo burrito.  Seemed slopped together. Honestly didn't taste very good.  However I must be fair and say my fiancée loved hers.  Mines another story.  Anyway. People=great.  Food=not so much.
author: Malcolm D.

description:
Bleh. I had heard good things and was in need of a quick bite with a friend. It was crowded, but the line was moving quickly so we gave it a shot. Their prices seemed high, but it is fidi, so it's all relative. I decided on a pork burrito, she got a chicken taco salad. The portions seemed huge, which is always a good thing, and the food was ready super fast, also good. 

That is where the goodness ended for us, sadly. My burrito was..,just sad. It was mostly beans and rice, then random, huge pieces of super dry, flavorless pork. It was wrapped funny so it also just opened up and exposed it's inner lack of goodness. Booo! 

My friend said her taco salad was also disappointing. Also now my stomach is killing me, which I notice a couple other folks mentioned in their reviews. 

I've been to a number of good taco places nearby, so I'll stick to those if the Mexican craving hits again at lunchtime, which less face it, hits only slightly less often than my gyro craving....mmm gyros. Sorry orale orale, I tried!
author: Jen C.

description: The food here is decent, but the service is pushy. Almost hostile. Most of all, the pricing is fishy. I ordered an item that was $4.99 on the menu, watched her ring it up, and the total mysteriously rose to $5.95. I was rushed out too quickly by her attitude to call her on the discrepancy, but taxes wouldn't even remotely account for this difference. She also gave me no receipt. Innocent mistake? In light of the clearly deceptive pricing, I can't help but wonder.
author: Lauren P.

description: nothing special. overpriced Mexican food that isn't very good
author: Shyan M.

description: Food was marginal but easy access while in the financial district. I saw on my bank statement the server had charged me twice for our one meal. I called them after a fax was sent to them, per their request to prove they double charged me. I hate to write they fraudulently charged our account because they thought we were visitors but what else can I think after 4 calls to the business to straighten this charge out!
author: Cheryl F.

description:
Nothing like cold wet lettuce in my burrito. Service is very quick though if you're there early.

I picked apart the weak excuse for a tortilla and actually found the carnitas inside to be quite delicious. However there were maybe 4 small pieces in the whole burrito. The rest is overwhelmed in sour cream, bland rice and pinto beans.

Where do the lines come from? And why? Is the FiDi Mexican food scene this desperate?
author: Aubrey O.

description:
I don't think I have ever eaten worse Mexican food ..

Fish taco- fish was way too salty, and smothered in some creamy sauce
Rice - too much turmeric
Beans- drenched in cheese.

Not going back ever..
author: P D.

description: I like this place quite a bit. Consistently great service, genuinely friendly staff, and excellent margaritas - and I'm picky about mine. :) This place is a staple on our happy hour list. Conveniently located, a very short walk from the FiDi and the Embarcadero.
author: Andrea M.

description: Just ordered taco bar from here. Embarrassingly small portions. Ordered for 6 people and it barely lasted 4 of us. They charged over $10 for maybe 1/2 cup of rice. $27.50 for one chicken breast. Will never go back here.
author: B W.

description:
I ordered Wet Vegetarian Burrito. It was good but the tortilla was very stretchy kind making it hard to cut into. However the filling were good. I liked the complimentary chips and salsa, spicy kind :)

Good place to try if you work in financial district and looking for place to grab quick lunch or dinner.
author: Rohini M.

description:
I would have to say that the food here is not bad, though the customer service can be questionable.  

Let's just say that if yelp were to permit a 0 star rating, I would be glad to offer that rating.

I ordered lunch from here for my team twice within this month and both times, I was not given an itemized receipt.  As a customer, I feel that it would only be courteous for restaurants to let customers know what they are charged for and the amount for each item (correct me if you feel differently on this as a consumer).

I called this restaurant and have asked the manager why I was never given an itemized receipt and the answer I received went like this: "Well, we're very old fashioned and we just enter in the amounts and throw away the receipts".  I don't know how the rest of you feel about this, but I wasn't happy.  My order was around $300 by the way.  I insisted in getting a receipt for what I have ordered (for reconciliation purposes) and the manager answers, "Well, I can't give that to you.  What I can do is make up something for you."  ... hmm, I don't know how I feel about having a made-up receipt (that probably has nothing to do with what I've ordered).  He then brushes me off saying that his shift was going to end in another 30 minutes ... I don't know where "good" customer service plays a role here, but I definitely do not see it.

I tried calling times after that but had no luck.  At one point, an employee who answered the phone hung up on me THREE times.  You're the one at fault and you're going to hang up on your customer ... awesome.

I had to literally walk over to their store to talk to them face to face for me to get my (made-up) itemized receipt and had to harass them by phone to get my (obviously again, made-up) itemized receipt for my second order.

Way to go, Orale Orale.  Your customer service will definitely bring you closer to success. 

Good luck,
Your never returning customer.
author: Vivien K.

description:
Love Orale Orale!!!  I come here all the time and this is by far my favorite Mexican restaurant in SF.  I could just eat their chips and salsa all day.

The staff is friendly, the food is fresh, the drinks are delicious, and their margarita selection is impressive!!! So good you'll keep coming back for more and more.
author: Puneet K.

description: A prime spot for authentic Mexican food in this part of the financial district area. Chipotle has opened up next door but Orale Orale still has the long lines and the full restaurant because people that are looking for real Mexican food comes here. Their salsa is some of the best in the city (even compared to Mission spots) and the fact that they have a full bar makes it even better. Personally, I always order the Chile Verde or Chile Colorado that comes with a side of rice and beans. Always love coming here for a long lunch with a good margarita!
author: Ray W.

description: I ordered a chicken burrito supreme. Came out to $7.75. They take all credit cards which is a plus for me and often influences if I come back. The burrito was a decent size but a little "squishy" and not firm compared to other places. Semi loose/tightly wrapped if that matters to you. It got a little sloppy at the end as a result. The chicken is shredded. I prefer grilled. The guac and salsa and rice and beans were a little "soupy" inside the tortilla. Doesn't bug me a whole lot but I'm just giving a description. You don't get chips (but you do get one small container of salsa to go), which I think should be an automatic. Chips are an extra cost to go but free if you dine in. I'd like to come back and try the enchiladas in house. Come try this place and see what you think.
author: Ben L.

description: Been going to Orale for 15 years.  Love the place, the food, the owners.  The best authentic Mexican in SF.
author: Tom R.

description: I would not even give a star to this Restaurant.  I took my friend there today for lunch, was telling her that the food is great.  When I got my usual order, carne asada, the serving got smaller and the meat and rice were dry and the price was increased by almost $3.   We finished our food but we we're still having our drinks and eating the chips when this guy took the check and chips, kind of telling us to get out.  When we complained to the manager that it was rude to just do that, he said that there were a lot of people waiting.  I told him that we had only been there for half an hour.   He said they it doesn't take more than that for people to finish their food.  I suggested that maybe they should put a sign that they cannot dine in for more than half an hour.  I said that I will YELP them.  He says that HE DOES NOT CARE.  I should have taken back the tip.  Do not go to this restaurant .  Food is not good anymore.  It's expensive .  They are rude.  If you want good Mexican food, I highly recommend Tropisueno in mission st by Metreon.  Good food, great customer service.
author: Jennifer K.

description:
I can't believe it has taken me this long to check out this restaurant since it's so close to the office! 

A few coworkers and I decided to get food from Orale Orale for lunch today. At about 12:45 the place was packed with a line out the door. We got in said line before realizing the (no-wait) line for take-out is on the right, the table service line is on the left. 

I ordered the shredded beef burrito with whole wheat tortilla. The woman at the register was not super friendly, but she gave me a number and very shortly after that my food was ready. 

Now, I'm a California girl born and raised and I know my way around a burrito, so believe me when I say that this was a TASTY one, full of goodness like guacamole and sour cream (which they did not try to charge me extra for). 

At $7.67 (including tax and whatever other charges the city of SF imposes on food establishments these days) for tasty lunch in the FiDi I'd say this place is a bargain.

Looking forward to many return visits and getting my hands on some of those chips!
author: Rachel E.

description: Upgraded because they are open at 7:30 a.m. and you can get one of their egg dishes or anything else on their menu.  There aren't many places open selling food that early and once I walk into my office I won't be allowed out again until 4pm so I need food.  The staff is nice.  I however do not like their burritos, they just don't wrap them tight enough so as soon as you open the aluminum foil wrapping, the thing starts falling apart and I always have to get a fork and knife, hate it when a burrito is like that.  Or better, I get their burrito bowl--same thing as a burrito (ingredient wise) but without the tortilla.
author: Kai T.

description:
This place has good spicy salsa. The camarones diabla were really good and the service by my waiter was great. (He's very very nice) but the yappy chick at the counter was classless and rude and made me think about walking out. The food is good basic Mexican food. I dig it.  So I will keep coming back to see my favorite warier and for the food. Hopefully crazy girl isn't around... Lol 

By the way, They have really decent prices for the area too!  And happy hour is great!
author: Alanna R.

description: One of my favorite go to spots for a good sit down lunch during the work week. The owners are the best guys ever, food is great and fast and reasonably priced. I LOVE this place.
author: Gwen R.

description: Good micheladas and great service.  The food isnt all that great, but still expensive.  I prob come here a few times a month and really like the servers!
author: Maude T.

description:
So this place is gross... 

No line whatsoever and the front girl ask for my order in a hurry. Hmmm I'm sorry, I am interrupting your conversation with your coworker. My bad. 

I order the 2 chicken enchiladas and sit down. Stale, gross, generic store bought chips and generic disgusting bland salsa on every table. Hmm... 

Food comes out looking quite sad. Nothing had flavor and it looked like they just slipped everything together. I hate saying this but I should have gone to rubios for my Mexican kick. 

***update***
I left my headphones here, thinking that they would be gone when I returned three days later. They kept them there for me, that's pretty awesome. I'm gonna have to give this place a second try based on their kindness. Thanks guys.
author: Ezequiel R.

description: Fast, cheap and good! Not exactly the Ritz but if you a staying in the local hotels and are looking for something different this place is great.
author: Michael C.

description: Best Mexican food in town.  It's silly that people used to wait in line at Chipotle when this place was around the corner!
author: Brady M.

description: We got there at 12:10 and the line was out the door. However, that was the take-out line. Stay to the left for table seating, which goes much faster. I had the chilequiles, which was excellent. The table service was great, and Alex keeps things moving. The seats turn over pretty quickly because most people are on their lunch hour. Not us. There was no pressure as we decided to linger. This is our new favorite Mexican restaurant in the FiDi.
author: Joe G.

description: Always fresh, always authentic.  I've been getting lunch to go here for eight years.  This is a good value authentic Mexican restaurant with no BS.  Staff is always friendly and hustling.  This place gets VERY busy, so show up early or be patient......or both.  If you want more of a FiDi blue shirt and khakis experience you can always go to Chipotle and join the herd.
author: Drew P.

description: Wow!  You can tell a lot about a restaurant by the amount of people inside and this place was packed.  Was able to get my food fast and efficiently.  What a delicious shredded chicken burrito!  The sauce that the chicken was marinating in was tasty! Just wish the hot sauce was actually hot.  Will definitely be going back.
author: Raj G.

description: For a satisfying burrito supremo or maybe just a baby burrito for a light lunch this place has it. I always prefer to go here for a sit down lunch since they give free chips/salsa for eat in customers. The carne asada and pollo burritos are a solid 4 star choice but if you come on thursdays you should definitely opt for "carnitas day". If you arrive around noon expect a wait because the other fidi workers know how good this place is too.
author: Norris T.

description:
Not a bad Mexican place for lunch.  

I had a combination plate with three enchiladas: cheese and chicken.  It was pretty good.  The beans weren't bad.

Also, the salsa was pretty good!

I'd give this place three stars if it wasn't for one thing:  The chips were very lame.  Not fresh cooked, cold and stale.

Verdict:  For lunch, if I'm jonesing for enchiladas, sure.  For dinner:  No way.
author: Ray I.

description: The food is overpriced and not great. In addition, this place has gotten my order wrong every time I've ordered to go from them. Today I came back THREE TIMES because they got my order wrong- the first time no chips, the second time lettuce when I asked for no lettuce in the burrito (yes they add lettuce so that they don't have to add real food in the burrito and charge for it), and the third time no beans in the burrito!... the third time i called I asked for my money back because I didn't want to walk all the way back to them again (and was told only if I returned and showed them there was no beans inside that I would get my money back- ridiculous but I did return and showed them!) and was only given $10 back even though my burrito was $11 and change. I wasted my whole lunch break going back to this place! I will never return, not because of all of the mistakes, but because of the rude attitude I got when I returned the food. I will make sure to tell all of my co-workers about this bad experience, especially because of the horribly rude attitude I got there. Ridiculous. Good luck with business with that customer service!
author: Jessie A.

description:
Hmmm...I don't know if I've changed or if this place has changed.  I would have easily given this place 5 stars back in 2002.  Yep..it's been that long since I've had a baby burrito here.  

Back in 2002, I worked around the corner and a bunch of colleagues and I made it a tradition to eat a breafast burrito every friday.  Oh, how I used to look forward to going into the office on friday's just to have one of these.  In addition, their salsa used to be hands down the best salsa I've had...nice & spicy and full of green onion and orale flavors.  

Today, I ordered the baby breakfast burrito...$3.25, with sour cream add $1, and chorizo, add $1.50 and voila...$5.75 for breakfast.  Kinda steep considering I had to play where's waldo with my chorizo.  Not sure if it's the sign of the times or if the restaurant is just trying to keep me on my diet.  Needless to say, not the best burrito and definitely not the best portions or price. 

Perhaps two stars would've been more appropriate but what can I say, I'm still holding onto the fond memories of burrito fridays w/ my beloved old colleagues.
author: Wina K.

description:
I Loooove this place!
I usually dont go for mexican food unless if it's my last option, like in a late night, except if I am in the Financial district and can go eat at Orale Orale. This restaurant is the best! They have the best burritos in the city!!!  I love their Seafood Supreme Burrito! Its awesome!
Plus they are just great people, very friendly and quick. and on top of that, it's really cheap! 
You can't go wrong if you go to Orale Orale!
author: Paula C.

description: Not in to this kind of Mexican food. It's almost fancy because it's sit down but it's plates smothered in wet glop. It's not in the least bit healthy. No black bean no dairy options. Even if you go with ingredients like crab it's a let down.
author: E. R.

description:
Why is this place so crowded? There is no taste at all to their food AND my burrito was cold in the middle.

Apparently they thought that I said , " Give me an all rice burrito that is salty as heck and cold in the middle." 

Very disappointing and confused as to why these other people are crowding in to this place.
author: Lost B.

description:
CRAB ENCHILADAS! Only available on Fridays! It's about $12. Pretty generous portions of crab. The enchiladas are topped with aurora sauce (it's like a white cream sauce). The sauce was too creamy for me, which kinda killed it a little.  It's not bad though, if you like that kind of thing.

I tried a bite of my co-worker's shrimp chimichunga and it was SO good. Shrimp, cheese, onions, and bell peppers in fried tortilla. 

Each dish came with a side of rice and beans. The beans were way too cheesy. It was like 50% cheese, which I don't prefer. 

The free chips and salsa were great! The salsa is spicy, just the way i like it!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
So I usually stick to my tried and true taquerias but I came to Orale Orale on a recommendation. 

I came in during peak lunch hours and ordered a vegetarian burrito ($5.50). Service was quick and I waited under 10 mins. for my order. They seem to handle peak lunch hours in the FiDi pretty well!

My burrito was pretty basic - it came with rice, refried beans, lettuce, tomato, cheese, sour cream, and guacamole. While it was a good sized burrito it was underwhelming. Everything tasted bland and it definitely needed the salsa that came with it, which was actually pretty good.

I can deal with a so-so burrito but what really got me was that your order doesn't come with chips. EVERY taqueria I've been to gives you complimentary chips with your food so what gives?

I'm glad I gave Orale Orale a shot but I'm honestly not sure if I'd come back here.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
I came to Orale Orale at 8:30 in the morning and each and every table had a bucket of tortilla chips accompanied by a bowl of salsa. I'm not sure why this was set up so early in the morning but the salsa was room temperature and the chips were stale; I can only imagine what they would have tasted like around lunch time. 

Regardless, I opened the menu and knew I was going to eat a burrito. Not the foolish breakfast burritos mexican restaurants try and fool you with, but a chicken super burrito. The burrito was HUGE but missing some guacamole (despite the menu saying it would be included). The burrito was decent.

The woman at the register was pouring more salsa into containers to prepare for the lunch rush (at 9am). Poor planning, wouldn't want to stick around for a later meal.
author: Tommy C.

description:
Good down to earth authentic Mex.Food!!  Like the mom & pops operation!
Happy hour makes you happy here.
author: J B.

description: Food was okay not great, bad, bad service arrived 7:30 p.m. closing time is 8:00 p.m since the minute we walk-in we were rushed. Bad mistake we made by staying we paid $80.25 for us to get rushed... I order one strawberry margarita huge disappointment! We were asked to pay as soon we got our food and my son was watching the Giants game and T.V.s got turned off really you still have customers we left at 8:05p.m. We were basically kicked out in 35 minutes! ridiculous spend $80.00 Will never return.
author: KARINA G.

description: Are you craving some tacos, burritos or flautas? you don't like to make a huge line at chipotle and be treated like an inmate ordering food in a food bar? Do you care about good and fast service? Orale Orale is the place to go.
author: H C.

description: I went this Poorly run Mexican restaurant on Friday afternoon. I ordered a chicken burrito to-go. While waiting for my burrito I sat down at one of the many empty tables (there is no area to wait for to-go) and ate a tortilla chip. Shortly after I got my burrito (very fast). I got up and before leaving I asked for some chips to go with my burrito. The server told me "well since you already stuck your hand in those ill put them in a bag" in a condensing voice. He then pointed at the sign that charges for tortilla chips. First, if I eat in the restaurant the chips are free but if I take my food to-go it's not free. Huh? Second, why are you charging customers for a few tortilla chips to go with their food. It's not worth the profit to nickel and dime customers. The burrito was not good enough to bother coming back.
author: Brian H.

description:
One of my favorite places to eat lunch, but they're open for dinner as well. Their salsa is outstanding - I often find that I can't stop eating the chips and salsa even when my entree comes out.

I never tire of eating here, and the only reason I don't come here every day is that I'd gain 5 pounds a week.

PROS
- Best salsa in SF
- Highly recommend the chimichanga and the carne asada
- They show sports (e.g. soccer, baseball) on their TVs

CONS
- Lines at lunchtime (between 11:45am-1:00pm) are insane

TIP
They have a full liquor license and serve margaritas with tequila.
author: Drew P.

description:
This goes out to anyone that gave Orale Orale anything less than a positive review! You're borderline retarded! You should be carried out to the desert and tied to a saguaro, and shot. I hope to god that you don't bring children in to this world because they probably won't appreciate good food, and great service either.   Actual factual.  Orale Orale is the best mexican restaurant in the fidi. The staff is awesome, the service is great, and the food tastes just like it's from the homeland. 
Viva Mexico! !
author: Nigel K.

description:
So disappointed in this place.

I used to go to Orale Orale 2-3 times a month. The prices were a bit high, but it's the financial district, so it wasn't surprising. It was good enough to be worth the price.

The last two times I went, however, the burritos were about 1/2-3/4 the size they used to be. Literally. It used to be when I'd get a burrito I could eat half for lunch, take the other half home for dinner. I'd get chips, too, so it was perfect. I'd be satisfied, but not stuffed full. (They charge for chips if you get them to go. If you sit down, you get chips for free.) When I went a few months ago, I thought it must be a fluke - they just were having one of those days. I went today, and sure enough, small burrito. Definitely not worth $9. Which pretty much sucks, because the shredded beef supremo was pretty decent.

Won't be returning.
author: Chloe J.

description: I have tried Chile Verde in every restaurant west of the Mississippi and Orale is the best. Nuff said.
author: John S.

description:
Picking up lunch for the office. I love love the margaritas here.
I'd ordered the Chile Veda very good, meat nice and tender and juicy.
This is definitely my go to place.
I use them a lot to order for clients. But today I order for the staff and everyone was very happy. I will order for the clients later on this evening.
author: Michelle G.

description:
i LOVE the burritos here!

the steak they use isnt the cheap kind you always get else where.

def want to try more of the menu however i cant come here and not get a super burrito.. i always end up sharing one with my coworker because they are pretty big.

Dropped a star due to the nachos. They are watery for some reason and that causes the chips to get gross.
author: Jackz C.

description:
I randomly met one of their employees by the ferry building who assured me that their food was pretty tasty. I ordered with super seafood burrito thing which was perhaps a mistake for a first review but I was feeling fishy and indulgent. 

It came out in a tray with this white cream sauce over it and really ended up just being a little too rich with all the ingredients kind of mixed together in a way that made it hard to differentiate what I was eating. Maybe I should go try something less crazy but that seafood thing wasn't my thing.
author: Misha T.

description:
My coworker suggested this place for lunch. A group of five of us headed over just after 11:30am today. It's located just across from Embarcadero Center 3.

The good:
- Cheap, authentic Mexican food. Most dishes were between $8 - $12.
- The rice and beans were really good. They sprinkle melted jack cheese over your beans, which I love :)
- Chips and salsa are yummy - the salsa is spicy and fresh made with chunks of tomato, jalapeno and onion
- Fast service (once you're seated)
- Portions are generous

The not-so-good:
- Long wait to be seated
- My fish tacos ($8.95) were okay, but I've had better. The fish itself didn't have much taste, so much of it came from the sauce.
- Seating is cramped so you won't have much elbow room.
- They don't sell Mexican drinks like horchata, agua de Jamaica (hibiscus juice) or agua fresca. Just soda or alcoholic drinks. For me, that's a big deal because I don't drink soda. And I also can't get boozed during my lunch break. So I just had water.

Tips:
- There are two lines here. The one on the left is to be seated. The one on the right is for to-go orders.
- It gets packed really early, so get there early or late to avoid a wait. We were there at 11:40am on a Thursday and had to wait til noon to be seated.
