Overall, it's a decent place for cheap Mexican food. I give it 3 stars. Of course, I'm also a harsher judge of Mexican food than the average person (for obvious reasons).

Orale!
author: Mariela D.

description: Good quick place for lunch. Good pricing. However I do not recommend the Chimichanga. Burritos are great!
author: Jason M.

description: Awesome food! I love their fast service & they have amazing burritos! I highly recommend this place!
author: Jessica N.

description: New to the work neighborhood, I'd heard good things about Orale Orale and decided to try them out. Meh definitely describes the experience. Small paltry portions of tasteless nothing. Perhaps if I'd ordered something listed as an Orale specialty, I would have had a better experience but my Beef Supremo Bowl was disappointing to say the least. Crossing it off the list and moving on ...
author: Leslie C.

description: Most overpriced Mexican food I've ever ate and not even authentic nor good not only that it's filthy , there was a cockroach near the table I was seated at towards back of restaraunt near kitchen. I do not recommend this place at all !!!
author: Louis A.

description: Carne Asada Supreamo is very good. The chips aren't my favorite but the salsa makes up for it. I will eat here again.
author: Ira P.

description: My favorite place to go for lunch in the financial district!! I seriously eat here at least once a week with my co workers. Their staff makes you feel like part of their family. Quickest service ever. I highly recommend them, I can't wait till they remodel and have their full bar I hear their margaritas are amazing!!!!!  Can't wait to try them;))) ORALE ORALE!!
author: Silvia S.

description:
Flavorless. I might as well have been chewing bran. I thought that this was a super grilled chicken burrito? It tasted like nothing.

The meat had no flavor. The rice had no flavor. The beans had no flavor.

Recommended? = No.
author: Chris R.

description: Starving one night and didn't feel like eating at boring Chipolte, which had a line of 20 people at 7:30PM.  WTH?  I headed down the block to give Orale Orale another chance and was so glad I did!  I had an amazing shrimp enchilada that was full of delicious and perfectly cooked shrimp along with a creamy sauce spooned over the top.  Sure, it probably had a zillion calories in it, but sometimes you just need to go for the gusto.
author: .Hon H.

description:
Tiny place and super packed during lunch time.  We came here at 11 to beat the crowds.  

The food, at best, was OK.  I've had a better burrito at Chipotle.  Chips and salsa were flowing, but I found the chips to be stale.

Not sure if I would come back.  As the lunch time crowd rolled in, I started to feel claustrophobic.
author: Miss P.

description: Of all the Mexican restaurants i have been too, this is the worse with customer service. I pressume the one by the counter are husband and wife owner. I only came here because my colleagues like to have Mexican food for lunch, Im from the Mish, so I really wouldnt spend money at Chipotle and the like, portions are small for the price. But then again its at FiDi, just because of poor service, I would never come back and I wouldnt recommend!!!!!
author: Malou C.

description: My favorite lunch place right now! Friday only crab meat enchiladas is my favorite. If two is too much, you can get just one for only $7.99. The salsa is another OMG. Walk 5 blocks here but it really worths. Highly recommend.
author: Daisy M.

description: Go somewhere else. Plenty of good Mexican restaurants located elsewhere in the city.
author: Alexander N.

description:
I have only eaten here a few times - always to go as I work right near by and just want to grab something fast and return to work. I have had a chicken baby burrito, a carnitas taco (I hear they only have carnitas on Thursdays), and a shredded crispy chicken taco. 

Everything so far has been good. I love the concept of the baby burrito. At only $3.50, it's a great deal for when you are just a little hungry and don't need a big 'ole burrito. Their shredded chicken is juicy and flavorful, unlike I have had elsewhere (shredded chicken can sometimes be bland). I am pretty much hooked on their shredded chicken crispy tacos at this point. Even though it's not listed on the menu, they have no problem with me ordering just one or two a la carte (instead of with beans and rice) - makes a great afternoon snack that won't spoil my dinner. The carnitas was also moist and juicy, although I did find a bit of fat in it. I prefer my meat without hunks of fat, but there was just a little bit, so not a big deal. 

I am picky about my Mexican food and will not settle for mediocrity. This place, from what I have had so far, is definitely better than average. Your food comes out quickly too. I agree it's kind of odd they charge for chips, but then again, most of the time unless I am dining in, I don't eat them anyway, so that works for me. I look forward to trying more menu items....I will definitely be back. Oh yeah, and Chipotle around the corner's got nothing on this place. I would never go there when I can go here.
author: Lizzy R.

description:
I have eaten here many times over the years. I ate here yesterday. I called my order in. I always order the crisy chicken tacos, rice and black beans. My order is always correct and hot. I love their salsa. Its always made fresh served with homemade chips.
The chicken is shredded, flavorful and juicy.

If your in the financial district of San Francisco you must come here it's totally worth it!
author: Kiana D.

description:
Salsa is fresh and good. Chips are also good with some salt added.

Ordered the crab enchiladas for the friday special. Tasty but a bit watery underneath. Had my food in about 2 minutes. Good thing?


Good beans and rice with the dish.

I was a little hungry still after the Enchiladas so I ordered  single crunchy chile verde taco. It was very good. 

I would eat here again and I liked the food, but I did not like the rushed feeling I got as they tried to turn over lunch tables. I understand it, but I didn't like it.
author: Mack L.

description: Just tried Orale finally for the first time after walking by it daily for the past 6 months, super let down. I ordered a grilled chicken super burrito to go that was unbelievably bland. The grilled chicken had absolutey zero flavor and almost had the texture of that boiled chicken crap that some taqurias use that don't have a grill. The burrito was also cold, only took me 4 minutes to get back to my office. I also ordered chips & salsa which was pretty lame and they gave me enough salsa for literally 10% of the chips they gave me. NO BUENO!!!!
author: Ryan C.

description: The food is just bad period.  I don't know why people come here.  They take no pride in flavor nor freshness.
author: Phil B.

description:
Again, Yelp needs to add half stars, now I'm forced to round down to 3 stars from 3.5, as I think 4 might be a little too generous. 

Orale has mastered the art of serving customers during the peak lunch hour. This, of course, is good when you're the person waiting in line for a table, but downright annoying when you're the person who feels that you're being rushed out. 

Based on FiDi standards, this place is actually pretty good. They serve good portions and their burritos are very tasty. They are a very popular place, deservedly so in my opinion. Service is lighting fast - and I mean really fast...so fast that you start to wonder how they were able to prepare your order so quickly. Again, it's all part of the mastery of highly efficient rush hour service. Then again, that does not bode well when I start thinking that any anything I order, it's probably already pre-made. 

If all goes well, you'll be in and out of there in less than 40 minutes, after devouring a fat burrito. You wont be hungry after that. Perfect time to go back to work for a long nap.
author: Angel S.

description: I really like this place, especially the shredded chicken crispy tacos. It's my go-to lunch spot for Mexican. The service is always good too - they are consistently packed at lunch but make sure that you are taken care of.
author: Rebecca B.

description: Take this from someone who grew up in Arizona 45 minutes from the Mexican Border, this place is really, really good, and an amazing value.  The food is consistently excellent and the service is friendly and attentive, and prices are very reasonable. As a lawyer who has worked in the financial district for the last ten years, I have eaten at Orale at least one hundred times, so I really know their food well.  Truth be told, if I were writing this review in Tucson, AZ, it would not be five stars, it would be at most a four, but we are in San Francisco where there is a dearth of good Mexican food anywhere but the Mission, where I rarely have time to go.  There is no better Mexican anywhere near the financial district, so I give it five stars. My favorites are the beef taquitos, ceviche tostados, green sauce enchiladas, taco platter, and the steak ranchero. I like the burritos as well, and the margaritas are yummy and not expensive.  Basically, the people who gave this place bad reviews have no clue about Mexican food or it was an anomaly and they should give Orale another chance.  While it is isn't fancy, it is a great place.
author: Patrick R.

description: Really Guys? 13 minutes to make a breakfast burrito? With no line! Plus to top it all off, a lady who ordered 5 minutes after me, got hers first! AND they forgot the tomatoes and onions in my burrito! Dude, it's only rice, beans, egg, onions, tomatoes, lettuce... how could you forget 2 ingredients.. It's not that difficult! Never again. :(
author: Malou W.

description:
A decent  and solid choice for Mexican food in the FiDi.

I had a chimichanga here and it was good - slightly crispy and flaky on the outside and soft and flavorful inside.  It came with beans and rice that were also good.  The chips and salsa were arriving freely throughout the meal.

While I wouldn't necessarily say that this is a great find, it is a good spot if you happen to be close-by and don't want fast food.  This restaurant has good food, nice service and is conveniently located.
author: Ken G.

description:
This is the best Mexican restaurant in the FiDi by far.

It is a small hole in the wall type of restaurant but don't be fooled. They seat you promptly, and serve you swiftly. The wait staff and pick-up counter staff all work like a well oiled machine. Lunch time can get crowded with long lines.

Once seated they bring you their awesome and very spicy salsa and chips. They are so addictive that I have tell myself to hold off or else I won't get far with lunch. Today I ordered chicken flautas. The plate comes with two so I asked for one soft and one crispy. Both were tasty and their rice is also pretty good. 

Great food and fast, good service. I recommend!
author: Shell I.

description: Came here for lunch with some co-workers and had the chimichanga.  I was about 2/3 done with my food when I found  a cockroach in my food.  I alerted the waiter who took my plate and said he would comp my entire party's meal and apologized.  He then came back to our table to elaborate on his theories of how the cockroach got on my plate, which I really didn't care to hear and only made me feel more sick. =X
author: Leen B.

description:
Used to work in the fidi and this was my go to Mexican place. The enchiladas are BOMB. Specifically, any enchiladas with the red sauce - haven't tried any other type, so can't comment on those. Also haven't tried any other menu items, so this is really a review of the enchiladas (4 stars instead of five though, to account for the likelihood that the other menu items are not as good). The red sauce is rich, fragrant (I think there's cinnamon in it), and flavorful. Never disappointed me in dozens of lunches I had from Orale Orale. I might even venture to say this is the best enchilada sauce I have ever had.

Now in south bay, and missing these enchilada lunches. If you are in the neighborhood and like a good enchilada, I highly recommend.
author: Grace S.

description:
Best real mexican food in the SOMA area of San Francisco. Somewhat pricey, but a place to come by every now and then for lunch. The place can get pretty packed around 12:30pm, so coming in around 11am or noon will give you a shorter wait.

Almost like any restaurant in the city, this is a fairly small place and definitely not the best for large groups. There is only street parking available if you plan on driving in.
author: Robb J.

description:
Average, reasonably priced, standard-fare "Mexican."

I honestly didn't find anything to either rave or complain about.
author: Dolph M.

description:
Best Mexican food in downtown SF!

Pros:
-Amazing red enchilada sauce!
-yummy burritos
-yummy Spanish rice
-great chips and salsa
-great service
-stays open until 8p
-fast service

Cons:
-gets packed FAST

When I have a craving for Mexican food, this is my place to go!  My coworkers and I always leave happy afterwards and always come back for more!  My coworkers and I usually order the chicken enchiladas, super burrito, flautas, and chimichangas.  My only complaint (not really a complaint) is that the enchilada plate doesn't come with sour cream (I love sour cream on my enchiladas and rice) but the red enchilada sauce and rice is so good I don't really mind.  

Will defintely be back!
author: J P.

description: my new regular lunch place. fastest service in the city. amazing food. about to head there now actually.
author: Mason D.

description: Good food, good idea, great varieties on the menu but, some really bombed the idea of fresh, while I had the 2 enchiladas with cheese and top with special sauce, the sauce didn't taste so special, the topping would be nothing but a taste of a can food. Special should come from fresh and that would make it special, service in restaurants usually take an order and they got a couple ahead, it took me two minutes to sit and a min to order and 3 mins my food was there, fresh doesn't take 3 mins to assemble, it takes 10 to 15 mins, I'm a chef I know the meaning of fresh.
author: Manuel V.

description:
I got the fish taco's here today. Between the quality of fish used, and the horribly bland "egg batter" they dipped the fish in, my meal was gross. I was only able to eat the rice and chips (chips sold separately?! what a scam), as the man who packed my to-go box put my tortilla's on top of the beans, so those were all soaked in and soggy by the time I got to my preferred eating place. 

Went back on my way back to my office to inform them that their fish taco's need some work. Only to have the Manager rudely inform me that "he sells SO MANY of those every day". 

Just trying to inform the man of a cold hard fact, and he decided to puff out his chest and get defensive. 

I may have paid for this meal, but it will be the last time. I'll do everything I can to make sure people are aware that here at Orale Orale, all they are interested in is your money. Your satisfaction is unnecessary for their business plan.
author: Elroy M.

description:
Ok so they could have been more creative with the name but as it states, this place is alright !
Chile Coronado is good, margaritas are strong, salsa is average. 
Service is good but this place is tiny and always packed at lunch so get there early or later( 1130 or 130) if you want a table. 
Decent Messican for the Financial.
author: Amy P.

description:
Their lack of a numbering system during busy take-out ordering times means that you ordered something that 5 other people waiting also ordered, so when they yell out, 'chicken burrito', a group swarms on the burrito and snares it before you, even when you know they came in after you.
I don't want to fight over the burrito, just use numbers or names for the order...
author: Kev M.

description:
If it weren't for the supremely strong margarita, I'd probably avoid this place. That, and also the fact that a lunch with a drink,including a tip comes up to only $20!

It tends to get packed during lunch hours, so you might want to walk in a bit early if you plan on eating in. The cheese enchilada was a little too bland for my taste. I've eaten better and I've made better. I'll come back to try the remaining stuff only because I loved the margarita!
author: Ranjani S.

description: I hate long lines, but this place is all the rage for lunch. And for good reason because its hella delicious. I ordered the Camarones ala Diabla (spicy shrimp with rice, beans and tortillas) and I was happy that I did. These really are the Devil's Shrimp because they were damn spicy. It was pure gluttony that I ate the huge portion myself. Seriously don't be greedy like me, you'll probably need to take it home for dinner or share with a friend. My coworker ordered a burrito which are pretty tasty too but from the look in her eyes, I could tell she was envious of my lunch plate. The only problem with this place is after such a huge lunch, going back to work was hard, I was seriously slothing from the subsequent food coma. 5 stars.
author: Huy V.

description: I really love this place for breakfast.  The folks who cook and serve absolutely could not be nicer.   The huevos rancheros are made EXACTLY right.   The salsa on the table is GOOD!!   I used to have to come to meetings in SF and stopped here before my meetings for my huevos rancheros fix.  I sat, checked email, watched tv, sometimes chatted with folks and got to practice some Spanish, ate the great food .  Service was always perfect -  food always hot and delicious and the eggs were always cooked right.   From the other reviews, it seems like lunch and dinner might be lame and way too busy.  Come in for a nice little breakfast.  Enjoy!
author: Stephanie S.

description:
WHAH?  I can't believe I have never reviewed this restaurant.  It's my favorite spot to eat downtown, and it isn't even close.  It's not fine dining and it isn't fancy, but if you are looking for a tasty, fresh lunch, and possibly a margarita, you can't miss with Orale.  Alex, one of the owners, is such a great guy and he runs a great ship.  He knows his regulars (there are a lot of them) and he treats us all like regulars should be treated.  I have found  myself heading to Orale for lunch even if I have the day off and have no reason to go downtown--that's what I am talking about. 
The salsa is spicy and delicious, and the mexican standards are all delicious.  I'm actually heading there now....yum.
author: Blake W.

description:
Once a week, I let myself cheat. Today, I wanted to have mouth sex with an enchilada plate. 

It was ok, cheap for the fidi. It was pretty busy, with all the take out orders and dine in patrons. They were quick with the take out orders though, so major points for that.

So....As I was leaving I asked if I could have some jalapenos. 

Lady looks at me, looks down, looks at me. 

"UH..."

me-*????*

"You have to pay!"

WTF?! You were just going to give it to me, then you tell me to pay--FOR JALAPENOS? Is it really that serious, (ok i'm making it serious)? I'm sure if I was eating there, no one would have issues with getting some stupid peppers. 

Damn you, lady, you jalapeno nazi!

Lastly, damn I ate too much of the beans...............
author: Thao L.

description:
I always knew Orale Orale had subpar Mexican food since I ate at OO a couple years ago and remembered that generally the food wasn't very good;  either it was under seasoned or the meat was tough.  Every now and then, though, a girl has to work late and gets Mexican food cravings.

I ordered a combo with a taco and enchilada (chicken for both), which came with rice and beans.  My god, I can't recall the last time I've had such flavorless beans.  The texture is fine, but what good is that if it doesn't taste like anything?    The rice was decent.  It was cooked fine and had hints of what mexican rice at other places taste like, just not enough of it.  The lack of flavor at this restaurant is appalling.

I remember while alternating between the chicken taco and the chicken enchilada that I couldn't tell which one was better.  Or, perhaps, I couldn't tell which one was less bad.  The seasonings and flavorings on both of these items were more  pronounced than for the rice and beans, but it still wasn't that great.  I couldn't really tell what direction they are trying to go with the enchilada sauce (red sauce? green sauce? mole? or some combination?).  That's not to say it's bad, but I prefer red sauce and I just didn't know what they are trying to do with their sauce.  The positive was that the chicken was tender on both items.  

Now, I know.  If I'm craving Mexican food while working late, just suck it up and eat something else.  Perhaps I could go to Rubio's, but I now know for sure that Orale Orale is just a bad idea.
author: Naoko M.

description: I've been going to Orale Orale for over 20 years. This is by far my favorite spot in San Francisco...and that's saying a lot because theres a lot of good places in SF. When I lived close I went to Orale for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Breakfast: I love the huevos con chorizo, lunch: the chimichangas are awesome, and dinner the enchiladas are always good. You have to plan for lunch because...IT IS PACKED...best to order ahead and pick up...or be prepared to stand in line for a seat. It's family owned and I have always been able to set my clock by the service. I have never had a problem and the family usually recognizes me on site. The margaritas aren't bad and the chips and salsa are excellent. Check this place out when you're in the financial district of SF.
author: Darren S.

description: Yuk! Stale chips, stale tortillas. Prob the worst Mexican place that I have ever been to. Almost as bad as Taco Bell. I had the shrimp tacos and they were gross. The serves was good, they serve you fast during lunch hours. :(
author: Sophia S.

description:
If Cracker Barrell made a burrito, this is what it would taste like.  Flavorless!
I would rank this place behind both Taco Bell and Chipotle.
author: Warren C.

description:
yum!  

My job caters food for meetings from here.

haven't been here in some time, last time i was here i ordered the chicken nacho plate. There was no way i could finish that all by myself. 

Recently, thanks to GoPago app. I had a craving for Mexican food, credit on my account (goPago) & luckily Orale is one of the options for this app. As soon as i got there, i was alerted my food was ready. Only a few blocks from my job. 

Like always the line was out the door. Luckily with the GoPago app, you can cut straight to the front. Not in the order take out line BUT a separate line. :)  
thank goodness.

hungry happy camper = satisfied!
author: Isa W.

description:
This morning, I had a crab omelet. I thought I would confess it right away, because it was so dam good and when I saw the plate, I thought I'm not going to eat the whole thing (it came with rice, beans and tortillas), and then I ate the whole thing. 

I'm not sure why I feel so guilty. I went to the gym this morning at 7am (with my home skillet Jenn-Jenn), we worked out and then treated ourselves to breakfast. I think the overwhelming feeling of eating something that good, makes me feel like leaving work and crawling into my bed where I could dream of the crab omelets, that are ONLY available on Friday.

But that's how much I love Orale Orale, it's so good you have to take a breather after eating it. I am absolutely full and got my crab on, so it's all good from here on today.
author: Rebekah T.

description:
BEST ceviche ever!!! No SERIOUSLY EVER! 

For the past year I have been subjected to hearing my Man talk about how amazing Orale, Orale's ceviche is. So I had very high expectations. 

As an actual Mexican I am always super critical of a Mexican food joint. But I must say that I was impressed. After a year of ceviche talk I finally got to try Orale, Orale and like all great things it was worth the wait. 

We got there and ordered the last of the ceviche (always a good sign of a popular dish). We also ordered margaritas and a delicious quesadilla. The margaritas were the perfect compliment to the most amazing ceviche I have ever had ( it was perfect, fresh, and delicious). WOW!!! 

Great service and amazing drinks and food, I cannot ask for more. By far my favorite Mexican place in SF!
author: Caro S.

description:
FOOD:
1.) Chicken Super Burrito = hm... it was cold. But they warmed it up again. And... it still just didn't taste that good? I'm sad to say it.. bc they were nice and I wanted to like this place. BUT maybe if I go back here, I'll get the enchilada combo that my friend got. That looked pretty good :) 


SERVICE:
Good good. They give chips and salsa while you wait. :) Half order togo and half sit down. hehehe



ATMOSPHERE:
Just a regular kinda small place. Near where a lot of companies are, so there's that funny bizzy bizzy lunch rush of working professionals at 12pm on the dot. lol. Well attired sheep.]

13
author: Angela L.

description:
I signed up with Yelp just to post a review of this place.  Best Mexican food downtown.  Best salsa in San Francisco.  I've tried most of the menu so far and it's all good.

Ignore the reviewers who gave 1 star, they are probably the take-out folks who crowd the restaurant and have no idea what this place is all about.
author: Daniel J.

description: This place is fantastic.  Was looking for authentic Mexican before we headed back home to Ohio.  Orale Orale didn't disappoint.   It made our trip complete!!!
author: Kirsten P.

description:
Good, non-chain Mexican restaurant in the financial district.  You can't really go wrong here with anything on the menu.  The chimichangas and soft chicken tacos are tasty, and the bottomless bowl of chips and salsa is great to munch away while waiting for your food.  Coming from San Diego, I would probably only give this 3 stars for the food, but it earns the 4th star for being there when you need it in the middle of busy SF.  

Warning:  Be prepared to wait awhile or get there early (like 11:20 during lunch hour), but the line moves quickly and they get you in and out of there rather smoothly.
author: Dan M.

description: My go-to spot for a burrito.  I prefer to get the food to go as the wait to sit during the noon hour can be long.  The chile verde burrito is a favorite here, however they are all delicious.
author: Dilly M.

description:
I visited Orale Orale on a whim. I was just passing by and saw that they served Mexican. I happened to be in the mood for a burrito so I figured I would check them out. It ended up being one of the worst customer service experiences ever. The lady at the counter didn't even acknowledge me until I stood at the counter for literally 5 minutes. She just continued to look down until I spoke to her. When I asked her about the menu (they have several choices for burritos) she acted as though she didn't understand me or she didn't want to. And if she did in fact have a language issue, i would have been totally fine with that had she been pleasant about it. 

As for the food, I have to say it wasn't totally bad but only "so so". I got the Carne Asada with a side of chips and salsa. The burrito itself lacked a bit of flavor but was still decent. I was hoping to enhance the flavor with the salsa. However, the salsa ended up tasting like plain tomato sauce. I literally pictured a big jar of plain Prego behind the counter as their source of this stuff. Thank goodness I got my food to go. I happened to love salsa and had a substitute at home. And as for the chips, they were  a bit stale.

In closing, I have to say that I don't normally leave Yelp messages but I really value customer service. As consumers, we at least deserve decent service. It would be nice if Orale Orale paid closer attention to this future forward.
author: H P.

description:
Food is good. Not amazing, but good. 

The cashier lady is kinda rude though. And I HATE that they charge money for salsa if you request more than one (if you are taking the food to-go). If I am paying $10 for a meal, I expect to get free salsa. This is so stupid. 

And I am pretty sure, the people who dine-in get free salsa. Shouldn't it be the same? People who are getting food to-go cause less overhead (cost) for the business. Then give them some free salsa.
author: Saumya B.

description:
Very cost-effective.  No frills, but good authentic'ish Mexican food.   Usually well frequented, which is usually a good sign.  

The beef tacos were awesome.
author: Michael J.

description:
I've spent a lot of time in San Diego where Mexican restaurants are like McDonalds. Their cheap and everywhere. You can get a burrito for $5 and its stuffed with cheap greasy beef. Many of the Mexican restaurants in San Francisco are more true Mexican food. But Orale Orale sort of reminds of the good old fast food Mexican. Its a little more expensive (about $8) but its quick and easy. The meat they use is actually pretty good. Its juicy and flavorful. I got the carne asada supremo, which came with guac/sour cream which is essential to any burrito. The tortilla they use is a little flimsy and tends to fall apart as it gets soggy from soaking up the grease and juice. 

The service was great. Caters to a lot of lunch time office workers so it gets backed. Theres are separate lines for take out and seating. They workers are fast and friendly which was a big plus to this place. They seem to have only one type of salsa and some store bought tapatio as their hot sauce menu so that was a little disappointing. Other than that the food pretty fresh but it could be cheaper.
author: Arthur C.

description:
Best salsa in the financial district!  Caveat emptor: it's spicy.  Essentially, the experience is pleasure spiked with pain.  

Going into a big sports/camping weekend, I'll stop by Friday after work and pick up a large container of their salsa* and big bag of chips.  Does life get any better?

They always have the giants game on TV during baseball season.  This is helpful when there's an away-game that starts early in the work day.  At 5:01pm I can duck in and catch a few of the late innings while enjoying a bottle of suds with chips, salsa*, and guac.  In fact, life does get better than as described in the previous paragraph.

Bonus: the guy that runs the place knows his Giants baseball (a heck of a lot better than I do).  He will call your BS, so you better know what you're talking about.

-

*Did I mention it's the best salsa in the financial district?
author: Mister P.

description: I called in my order after the lunch rush and the guy on the phone said 5 minutes.  It took me about 7 minutes to walk there.  And yes my food (baby burrito) was ready!  And my co worker called in her food right as I was walking in and hers was ready in five minutes.  This was the best five minutes of my lunch break.  Hands down Orale Orale will get you in and out!  I always go here, but happen to write a review today!  Definitely worth trying!
author: Sa S.

description:
Hit or miss.  The chile verde burrito and the enchiladas verdes were just OK.  Pretty bland but OK.  Which is about what you'd expect for the only Mexican place in the financial district.  No I will not count stupid Rubios, fucking La Salsa, or the place on Kearny. I'd sooner count Jack in the Box because they have better tacos.  Even though El Faro is next to that, I'm not counting it either because it's so ghetto and craptastic.  

Anyway, the other day I ordered a super carne asada burrito from Orale and was actually impressed.  It's So Cal style, lots of lettuce and rice.  But it also had a crapload of juicy seared steak, and that steak was well marinated.  You could taste the citrus!  They didn't fuck around on the guac, and it was actually good.   Real lard tortilla, grilled.  The thing was huge, and I demolished it without pity or regret.  Only $7 too.  Ya can barely buy a hot dog and a coke for that around here.

So if I'm going to work in this urban deathtrap for a few more years, I might make Orale a more regular thing now that I know they can do something well.
author: Jared L.

description:
Had a hankering for a quesadilla today so popped on over to Orale.  Got the chicken quesadilla which I thought was very good.  Not too cheesy and the chicken was well seasoned. Plus, the thing was massive.  It came with salsa, guacamole and sour cream although I would have preferred a scoop of rice and beans as well, but you have to order those extra, along with the chips.  

On the plus side of having to order extra, they give big portions.  Even the $1.00 small bag of chips is larger than you'd get at many other Mexican places.  The side of beans and rice was large enough for 2.

Went just before 12 noon and there were people out to the door, however that line was for sitting down and the line for takeout had no one in it and I got my food right away.

My meal (without a drink) was about $12 and I would just skip the sides of rice/beans/chips next time which would bring that down.  Would be nice if they gave you just a little of each with your meal.

All in all, I thought it was very good and I noticed they have breakfast burritos which means I'l be going back to see if they do that justice.
author: Jared W.

description: I'm giving them 3 stars because although their food is great, I feel that every time I order their carne asada burrito, I end up tasting a lot of, cinnamon? I'm not sure what they marinate their steak with and I can't quite figure it out. Other than that, its nothing out of the ordinary either, but it is good.
author: Reyna V.

description:
I *heart* cheese. And they use a lot of it.

I also *heart* spicy salsa. And hark, for tis spicy. 

Unfortunately I do not *heart* tiny margaritas filled with ice and not much else for six dollars. 

Alas, for other than the above, it was your standard American-Mexican place, that seems to be created for the Fi-Di taste buds.

Sighs...so close, yet so far away...
author: Danielle L.

description:
Does what it says on the box.  Americanized Mexican, shredded lettuce, refried beans, tostada salads, etc. 

Showed up early (11:45), waited about five minutes for a table and was seated with chips and salsa. Shared the tostada and tostada salad with someone else and it was pretty good.  Thursday is apparently carnitas day so you can get carnitas on your food instead of the standard chicken or ground beef options.  Highly recommend this! 

It was fast, the waiters were friendly, and the food was pretty good.  I'll be back when I want to slip into a food coma in the afternoon.
author: Peter M.

description:
Occasion: Breakfast with co-workers 

What I Had: Breakfast burrito ($4.25) 

Food Review: Their breakfast burrito includes scrambled eggs, tomatoes, onions, lettuce, rice, whole beans, and chorizo. Albeit a rather small burrito (about 1/3 the size of a Chipotle burrito), for $4.25 and a medley of ingredients, it was a good deal. The chorizo was delicious, but I didn't like the lettuce in the burrito mostly because I am of the belief that breakfast burritos almost by definition should have no lettuce. 

Service Review: (Co-worker picked it up) 

Venue Review: The venue is small but homey. They have plenty of seating with wooden tables and chairs and the restaurant may be small, but certainly not claustrophobia-symptom inducing. 

Overall Impression: I'd definitely grab a breakfast burrito from here again, but next time I'll ask for no lettuce. Other than that, it's an okay burrito for a good price.
author: Rachael K.

description:
Urban Dictionary says:

Orale:  Spanish word used among Mexicans meaning 'right on', 'hell yes', 'okay' and 'alright'; usually said enthusiastically.

Amy C. says:

Orale Orale:  Spanish phrase meaning 'ordinary Mexican food with mediocre ingredients', 'burritos as big as your head', 'weird sauce on the seafood enchiladas' and 'go to the San Buena Taco Truck at Sansome and Pacific instead'; usually said while yawning.
author: Amy C.

description:
This is a great little spot acrsoos from the Banana Republic in the Financial District.

The servers are great guys.  They are quick and entertaining.

The salsa is amazing. One of those you want to take home and eat for the next week.  I also love the crab enchiladas but you can only get them on Fridays so keep that in mind.

Oh ya....the chimis are to die for too!  

All and all a great little mexican spot that is very fair in price!  Be prepared to wait a few minutes for a table but it's worth the wait!

ORALE!!!
author: Reggie A.

description:
Stopped by Orale Orale yesterday for the Veggie Burrito & it was mighty tasty

Whole Pinto Beans & Rice w/ Lettuce-a-la-Jalapeno & Sour Cream / Guac to finish it off

Could have used more beans & kinda disappointing to hear they wouldn't swap out Black Beans for the Pinto - but still tasty & would get it again

Also agree w/ others' comments about not supplying chips - that's just blasphemy

Towards the end of my burrito, the tortilla started getting all hard so had me wondering if it wasn't fresh.....but no stomach aches during the night so all was good

Bonus Points for the glops & glops of Guac = YAY

Minus Points for few beans & no option for Black

All equates to a comfortable 3 stars
author: Adrienne G.

description:
This is solely for their Burrito. Pork Burrito Supremo, more specifically.

Okay, so I brought this onto myself. I waited too long before grabbing lunch, and was too famished to trek over to Rico Mex or Chipotle. I was also forewarned by fellow Yelpers, but I thought, "how can one REALLY mess up a burrito??" 

Well, the way this burrito is wrapped leaves rice and beans on one end, and mushy mayo-esque sauce with lettuce on the other, separated by a BIG clump of braised pork meat smack in the middle. Never figured out how to eat it. But I was so starving that I ate half of it!!

::fast forward to 1 afternoon meeting later::

I was still hungry, but something told me not to open up the foil wrapper. I ultimately regrettably had to toss the other half before the end of day. 

Although I found the pork decently meaty and pretty yummy. The burrito just did NOT work. They need to 1) slice up the pork meat; and 2) ease up the drippy mayo-sauce - too watery! also, 3) what's up with the scallions?! and lettuce!! 

I'm going back to Rico Mex, even if I have to drag my malnourished body. Ole!!
author: Jing D.

description:
I really like this place for its crispy tacos.  Overall, the quality of food at this place is fairly good, but it gets an extra star due to the FIDI dismal selections.  I do really like the rice and beans they serve as well as the fresh salsa.  I think for how busy this place is you would expect it to be much better but there really are few other choices, which in my opinion elevates the ranking.

Also, some super cute woman frequent this place for lunch.  O-lay!
author: Darin E.

description:
That this place has 3.5 stars on yelp is a testament to the downward spiral towards mediocrity that we've been seeing the past several years.  This place is,  by no means, above average.  Any statement to the contrary necessarily is borne of ignorance and/or faulty palate.  There are no words to express the abysmal ratio of quality-to-price that this place offers.  

LOOK AT THE PICTURES.  The food just looks shitty, even in the pictures. 

I'm not even going to try to make this review funny; the food fucking blows and you're better off going to Rubio's.

Ugh.
author: Michael P.

description:
I truly don't understand why this place is usually so crowded. All I can guess is that every other casual joint in the neighborhood must *really* suck. 

I've given "Orale Orale" two chances and won't be back. It's overpriced, bland, midwestern-mall Mexican food, indifferently prepared & apathetically served. Chevy's & other chains would be a significant step up and I suspect their prices are comparable. I don't require a tiny hole-in-the-wall undiscovered gem; I just want good value for money, and I think I'm right to expect more from San Francisco (even in the financial district).
author: Nerd G.

description: Just tried Orale Orale after a coworker mentioned he liked it.  I found the food quality to be below average/on par with high school cafeteria or TV dinner....Had chicken taco and beef enchilada combo and coke for $17 including tip.  Salsa too hot with chips.  Bum steer.  Chipotle worth the wait next door!
author: Lee O.

description: Best heavy Mexican relatively quick food in financial district area.  The line from 11:45 on speaks to how good the food is.  The salsa is fabulous but a bit hot.  My favorite dish is the grilled chicken burritos.
author: W P.

description:
I ordered the Burrito Supremo with ground beef for $5.50. The size of the burrito was good, but tasted a bit plain. It also felt like the burrito was going to fall apart while I was eating it; the food wasn't packed very tightly in the burrito I guess.

Atmosphere: The restaurant has a seating area for dine-in only customers and a separate line for those ordering food to go. The food was prepared faster than I thought considering the dine-in area was packed with more people awaiting tables, maybe about 10 minute wait.
author: Norman L.

description:
THEY REMEMBER MY NAME!!!
I have been going to eat at Orle Orle for almost 5 years! It doesn't seem like it (my dose time fly by). I have always ordered the baby chicken burrito and every single time I ordered it, it was so good. I have invited friends and relatives to come dine with me for lunch and they to had good things to say! My sister was the only person that didn't like it because she is so very very very very picky and you almost just can't satisfy her. They're Salsa is very taste! I have tasted a couple of other things such as their vegi burrito, there beef burrito and their rice. All are so good. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone who like Mexican food or want to try Mexican food. OH and the People there are Great!
author: Notagame A.

description: I tried their burritto for the first time today and I regret it!! I was just running late and wanted to grab something quick from work and run back in. I mustve ordered something wrong.It was really really bad. I love mexican food and  I really did try to understand why this tasted bad. Firstly,maybe because i asked for a whole wheat tortilla? The wrapping was bad, everything started falling apart. I am only giving them 2 stars 'coz there was some guac in it! Second, I specifically asked for Chicken and there was absolutely no meat in it! Just rice and beans...! Don't think I want to waste $10 again... sorry!
author: Monica M.

description: I've said it before and I'll say it again....I've yet to have out of this world Mexican food in San Francisco. Having lived in L.A. and San Diego I guess I was spoiled by the mexican food down there. Something about it up here just doesn't have that spice and kick for me. I had the chips, cheese enchiladas and rice. All were subpar.
author: Greg J.

description:
Terrible. Don't ever eat here. 

I ordered a shredded beef burrito & I seriously thought they got the order wrong & gave me a veggie one. The amount of meat in this thing was laughable. I would have taken it back but I was already a few blocks away & I am quite a lazy person. There were literally only a few shreds of meat in it. They did have sour cream in the burrito for no extra charge but that's no excuse for virtually omitting the meat all together. My buddy ordered a chicken burrito & his was the same. A veggie burrito w a hint of chicken. Plus it was soggy as hell for some reason. This place sucks worse than Chevy's & Taco Bell combined. That's a bold statement right there. 

This is probably one of the absolute worst burritos I have ever eaten & I'm a fat Mexican so I know my burritos. Don't waste your hard earned money here.
author: Alex R.

description: Delicious and affordable Mexican food. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Quick takeout. Nice little spot. No frills atmosphere; very casual and comfortable. Will definitely go again.
author: Neuftearia S.

description: Very good food for the price. The waiters are really cool there also. Our waiter cracked some pretty decent jokes, especially considering he didn't speak English that well.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Came with a couple of my co-workers and this place is PACKED during lunch. We came around 11:40, and probably got seated around 11:50. By the time we left at around 12:35, there was still a lot of people waiting to get a table!

Food: It was nice to have chips and salsa (for free!) since the beginning of service. The salsa was spicy, but I liked it. Chips were a bit too stale for me. I got a pork burrito supremo, and when they say supremo, they MEAN supremo. That burrito was HUGE, and definitely served as 2 meals for me. The pork was just okay. I liked how they added guac in it, but I've definitely had better burritos before. 

Service: Fast, fast, fast! Waiters are always available, and food came out pretty fast -- I guess they have to considering they're so busy all the time!

The only thing I really didn't like about the place was the DIFFERENCE in price with take-out and table service. I understand that having table service is a bit more expensive because of the manual labor, but why do they have two separate pricing for the food?? I don't think the portions are different either, so I think that's a bit too ridiculous. So I would probably recommend to take-out and eat somewhere else, to save yourself a couple of bucks!
author: Evelyn S.

description: I went to this place on a recommendation for lunch. The place was okay. I must say they were very fast considering how busy it was. I had the crispy chicken tacos which weren't bad. My friend had the quesadilla which by the time we got to eat some where, it was soggy. We were going to try and sit down after we ordered our food but one of the workers rudely yelled at us and said we couldn't because we ordered in the take out line.
author: Natalya G.

description:
This place is awesome to catch up mexican, homestyle food if you are in the FiDi.

Only problem, its freakin packed and there isn't much seating.  Suggest coming before the 12PM rush or after 1:30PM.  Seats are hard to come by and can only seat small parties.

Suggest the tacos and enchiladas.  It doesn't say on the menu it can be made with pork but you can ask.  Pork is the best ones.

You can also get it to go, but the line is always long for both take out or sit down.

The chips and salsa are also really good.

The atmosphere is very loud so its hard to have a good conversation.
author: Kameron K.

description:
My first introduction to the expression "Órale" came from a Mexican girl I knew in college who used the term frequently. I've since learned that the expression has spawned all kinds of pop-cultural exploits, from the name of the Beck album Odelay to the frequent utterances of Cheech Marin.

And there's this restaurant, too.

I was pleased to find out that this is actually a sit-down, waited-tables kind of place. That's nice to indulge in during your lunch break in the FiDi, where the status quo is a line to order, a wait for pick-up, and then carrying your lunch back to work. This allows you to sit, relax, and enjoy their complimentary chips and salsa. The salsa, while only in the mild-medium range of the spicy spectrum, is a flavorful and piquant-enough contrast to the blandness of a day at the office. It's good. 

I ordered the carne asada supremo burrito, without sour cream, and I was impressed with the quality of the ingredients. I even think they compensated for the lack of sour cream with more guacamole, which wins my heart over any day. Ryan B. ordered his standard bean-and-cheese (not standard on the menu), and he was pleased.

I will be back some time, but not too frequently, since $10 for lunch is hardly sustainable for me.
author: Nicholas F.

description:
Friday 11:45 am - lunch rush hour and I was desperate for avocado, sour cream,  beans and chicken. Desperate for take out.

Orale Orale was packed with people waiting for a table. I looked for the line to place take out orders but there wasn't one. I was confused. I walked up to the register. Nobody stopped me. I ordered a chicken burrito supremo with cheese. I waited 2 minutes max. They called my number. It wasn't a mistake.

The chicken burrito supremo was all the avocado, sour cream, beans and chicken. I was so happy. Never going to Chipotle again.

Bonus: I hate cilantro. There was like no cilantro.
author: Jen Y.

description:
Orale Orale hit the spot today!  I was really craving some of their delicious crab enchiladas but it's not Friday so I had to settle for the seafood enchilada instead.  The problem was, the flautas were talking to me too.  Luckily you can do a combo plate with whatever you want and that was exactly what I did.

I cleaned my plate.
author: Cindy C.

description: I stopped in today for lunch.  I've always liked this place when I want to have a social lunch with my co-workers during the week.  There's always a line for seating, but it moves along steadily so that we can squeeze in our lunch in about an hour.  The food is tasty and is served pretty quickly once you're seated.  They give you chips and salsa while you wait for your food.  I usually order the chicken enchiladas or the carne asada plate.  It's also reasonably priced too.
author: Alvin J.

description: Dined at the orale orale on tuesday evening. The food was delicious and the service attetive. The salsa provided with warm chips that were all very tasty. The waiter noticed our enjoyment of the salsa and brought us out a second one. Check it out guys!
author: Howard J.

description:
The burritos here are huge.  Different prices for dine-in/take-out.  I got the seafood burrito to go but it instead of it being wrapped in foil, it was placed in a sealed container b/c it's poured with some cream sauce ... which I would actually have preferred to do without.

Not a bad option near work ... but nothing to write home about.  

Also, other than a small container of hot sauce, no real condiment bar (salsa, lime, etc.).
author: F. P.

description: Hey, what do you expect? Cheap Mexican in the middle of FiDi... Good food, friendly service.
author: Mary Ellen B.

description:
I came here for lunch with a co-worker. She knows the owners so we got free guacamole! The chips and salsa were addicting and spicy. I had the Seafood Supremo. It was like a big wet burrito with creamy sauce over it. There wasn't as much seafood as I imagined. My co-worker got the chicken flauta and enchilada which she enjoyed. The meal was reasonable for the price.

It gets pack fast so be sure to come early if your planning on having lunch here!
author: Jennifer D.

description:
Yummy Mexican food near work that isn't expensive. I like the chips and salsa already provided on the table. Service isn't too bad either, you get your food in a decent amount of time. Trick is to go there early so you don't need to stand in line. This place gets really packed between 12-1:30p! 

My fave dish so far is the "Orale's Surf & Turf." It comes with carne asada and four huge shrimps, rice and beans. Choice of corn and flour tortillas. This is SO YUMMY! A bit heavy for most people at lunch, so I usually eat half and save the other half for later. 

If you work nearby, this is a great place to go for Mexican food.
author: Julie L.

description:
I've lived in San Francisco for over 5 years, but never once have I felt like a true "regular" or "local" at one of the many restaurants and bars that I frequent.  I've always wanted to hear everyone shout my name as I enter a business, like they do when Norm from the show 'Cheers' arrives at the bar.  My quest to feel a part of an establishment finally ended at Orale Orale.  Its not only the best food downtown, but it makes the financial district not feel so cold and professional.  

Everyone at Orale has a smile on their face and the service is unmatched, even when its a busy Friday afternoon. 

The chile verde is my dish of choice, but the tacos aren't far behind.  I'll bet that anything on the menu will suit your appetite.

Also, I don't know what they put in their salsa, but its the very best you'll have and, did I mention, its on the house!
author: Alex D.

description:
Easy place to grab lunch. Super friendly service. While the food is nothing special, it was solid. Their salsa is a little on the spicy side. Taco, enchiladas is what I would recommend. They were a little better than the flautas. 

Come early as the place gets packed. But you can always get your food to go.
author: Lingo L.

description:
tl;dr unsatisfyingly unhelpful cashier won't give us any suggestions. 

Some coworkers and I came after Orale Orale was recommended by a fellow colleague. If you're coming in for lunch at peak hour, note that there are two lines: one for sit down and one for takeout. The sit down line was packed almost out the door, but the takeout line was relatively short. 

My coworker and I didn't know what to get, so we asked the cashier when we reached her. She kept saying "I don't know" to our inquiries, and I don't know why, but that got me a bit worked up.  Why won't you answer a question of what YOU like? 

After that we both got the carne asada supremo burrito, apparently a signature dish by Orale Orale. It was a pretty decent burrito, and it has a nice Mexican kick to it. It contains guacamole, so all is good. Overall, decent food, but that afternoon encounter definitely slowed them down.
author: Jason T.

description:
VERY basic down and dirty Mexican food. My grandparents are from Mexico, so I have grown up eating authentic cuisine from basic tacos to enchiladas verdes to awesome chili rellenos. This place is not up to par. 

Had two carne asada tacos, which come with rice and beans and guacamole on the taco. Not sure what others are talking about here, but the carne asada was tough and did not have much flavor. Guacamole was creamy and did not taste fresh. Refried beans also did not have much flavor and the rice was not your standard orange Mexican rice (which gets its color from tomato or El Pato sauce). This rice was yellow. 

For slightly higher prices, go to Mexico DF on Steuart and get some very flavorful tacos and FRESH guacamole (you can even get it with shrimp and bacon).
author: Bobby A.

description:
I love love this place since my best friend brought me here and since then we go here a lot for our lunch dates. Orale Orale gets PACKED during lunch time so plan accordingly. We have gone there at 11:30 or 1 and the lines werent as bad but at noon, ya, expect the line to hit the door. 

But do not let the lines discourage.. come back! come back! cuz the food is awesome! its a quick, authentic mexican restaurant. They seat you pretty quickly and the service and food is quick! 

I have ordered the nachos, burritos and the combo specials. I love their Chile Relleno.. its awesome! The portions are great for lunch plus an afternoon snack. 

This will def continue to be a fav lunch spot!
author: Jayashree S.

description:
My education in Orale Orale accounting continues. Today's lesson: how to turn a $3.25 baby burrito into a $4.50 baby burrito:

+ $0.75 for grilled chicken
+ $0.50 black beans

As I'm no stranger to surcharges here, I wasn't too surprised. The extra for beans was expected, learned that last time, but extra for grilled chicken? What? And where is my discount for adding rice even though I asked to have that left out?

Flour tortillas remain the only option. Almost want to see what they'd charge for wheat. Does this mean I'm into burritomasochism?
author: Jason B.

description: The only place to hit when you need a Mexican food fix in the area. From steak & eggs in the morning to a chile relleno plate for lunch everything I've tried it pretty good. Great place to pick up a load of breakfast burritos for the pack at the office. Although substituting beef or chicken for the $4.99 chorizo will boost the price up to $7.25. Then again we are in the FiDi. If you're wanting to dine in for lunch get in early! This place fills up quick and can leave you waiting longer then your lunch break allows you. But I can guarantee as soon as your seated the great staff gets you ordered, fed & out of there in a flash without making you feel rushed.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
I am told this is better than Rubio's but I could not agree. 

I had the enchilada with chicken and the taste was on the quiet side. Chicken was good, the beans were okay, but it just did not wow me like Rubio's. Rubio's is like Beethoven that has more notes and surprises. This dish was good and the salsa was excellent and spicy but no chips. I actually thought they would throw in some chips. 

Will have to go back for other dishes and see if they would earn more stars.
author: T L.

description:
Pretty decent burrito.  Not just for FiDi, but dare I say it - even by Mission standards.  It's not wrapped as well as I would like but the stuffing inside make me forget how it was a little messy to eat.

Much better than Pancho Villa.
author: Jean K.

description:
Worst breakfast burritto I have ever had. Period. Almost all rice and lettuce. Zero flavor. This place is bad. 

I was in dire need of a breakfast burrito and felt like giving this place a second chance. I totally regret it.
author: Mike I.

description: I've been going to Orale Orale for almost fifteen years now, so I guess you could say I'm hooked.  The service is extremely efficient, if not overly friendly, and if you avoid the lunchtime crush, it's really not a bad place to sit and enjoy your meal.  If I had to choose a single highlight of the food, though, I would say it's the rice and refried beans that come with almost every menu item.  Even if you don't usually like refried beans, like me, there's something about theirs that make them irresistible (hint: I think it might be lard).  All I know is, I keep coming back for more.
author: SJ H.

description:
Got the Two Corn Quesadillas yesterday for lunch. They weren't anything special - even I who can't cook can probably make up something a little more enticing. Not to mention, they weren't even of a normal-sized quesadilla.  Rather, there were 2 puny little tortilla with only cheese inside.  Not even worth trying for $5.80. 

The Tostada salad (which turns out can be made vegetarian) looks much better. I will give that a try next time before completely writing this place off.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
I don't think the food is that great here but this place always has a line during lunch.  I've been there a couple of times with colleagues or friends that want to eat there.  

The food is a very generic Americanized Mexican food that's heavy and flavorless.  The food is often topped with load of cheese & sour cream with very limited use of seasoning.  I've had their chile verde enchiladas, regular enchiladas as well as the chimichanga.  None of those are really worth eating.  After eating there I always feel terrible due to the overload of sour cream, grease and cheese. The worse part is that it's totally not worth the calories!
author: Paul K.

description: Less than average food, confusing atmosphere, steep price that is not relational to the quality of food that you receive.
author: Drew F.

description: Disgusting. There is nothing more I hate than inconsistency at a restaurant and Orale Orale is as inconsistent as they come. I typically have the Huevos con Chorizo. The first time I had it, it was really good - but, the past two times it hasn't been good at all. In fact, I had it this morning and after only 3-4 bites, I threw it away. It was bland, the beans were watery, and overall the dish had ZERO flavor. The only thing good about it was the tortilla and that's why I'm giving one star - plus I have no choice and have to give one star. I feel sick now... thank you Orale Orale - I will never return. What a waste of money.
author: Noneya B.

description: I come here often. Food and service is consistent. I mostly get take out and the take out line may seem intimidating but the food gets to you fast. They are always so nice and helpful. So many favorites come to mind and are super delicious (ham breakfast burrito, chorizo with eggs, cheese enchiladas, Carne Asada tacos, chicken quesadilla, chicken flautas, beef flautas and the burritos).
author: Christina C.

description:
This place is close to work and a co-worker is a big fan so thats how i started coming to Orale Orale. I think it's a grea little mexican joint. I've had the burrito, tacos and tamales and all are SUPER delicious. The service is better when you actually sit down and eat at a table, but during the lunch rush (and belive me it can get crazy busy) its understandable because they are trying to get people their food quickly. Prices are pretty good too. I really enjoy the food here alot.

Oh and just FYI the to-go prices are cheaper because if you want chips it's extra $ the sit down prices are a little more because you get the chips and salsa and water and all of that...but i think it's still reasonable.
author: Kimberly R.

description: Orale Orale is probably the best Mexican restaurant in the FiDi.  I went here many times during my lunch break.  I usually order their Seafood Enchiladas ($8.99 - flour tortillas made with scallops and shrimp topped with aurora sauce, diced ham and parmesan cheese served with rice and beans) and their Chicken Chimichanga ($8.25 - deep fried flour tortilla filled with chicken and beans topped with sour cream guacamole, mid salsa and parmesan cheese served with rice and beans).  Both are really good, but I highly recommend the Seafood Enchiladas.  They also make a really good breakfast chorizo burrito for $5.  As usual, it's best to come here early because the place gets packed really fast during the lunch rush.  Good food, not too expensive...you can't go wrong with Orale Orale!
author: Rodney H.

description:
What do you do if you want authentic Mexican food in downtown S.F.? Taco trucks don't come to the financial district. I am thankful Orale Orale (Which means "Cool" in Spanish) has weathered the storm all these years and hung around.  

It gets very crowded at lunchtime. Line out the door just to order for takeout. Come early if you plan to do table service. 

The salsa is fresh and homemade. The tacos, chilli rellenos, and enchiladas rock. They offer great entree plates as well as the requisite burritos. 

I hope they hang around for a long time.
author: Infodiva B.

description:
I am a huge fan of authentic Mexican food and this place is it.  It's not the Mission, but I work down the street so it all works out for me.  This place packs out during lunch so unless you show up before 11:30 or after 1:30, expect to wait to be seated.  

They are very efficient though and move everyone in and out w/o making you feeling rushed.  The salsa is yummy and my favorite entree is the combo dishes where you can mix and match.  The enchiladas w/ the red sauce is to-die-for!  Prices are decent and staff is friendly.
author: ThirtyTwo P.

description: Super friendly and attentative service.  The enchilada was excellent. I didn't know the difference between the red sauce and green sauce that were offered, so our waiter said since there were 2 enchiladas in the meal, he would do one of each.  Both were good and neither were spicy,  but I loved the red sauce... it was a lot more flavorful.  I really enjoyed this meal.  Also had the strawberry margarita which was good... perfect combination with their spicy salsa! When the bill came, I was shocked by how reasonable it was... definitely a good value.
author: Ali K.

description:
After years and years of eating at this place, I FINALLY tried something new.  I usually get the burrito supremo or the chicken burrito plate, but this time I decided to go out on a limb and tried the seafood supremo.

Oh my.  Totally not what I expected.  it was better.  Huge burrito stuffed full of Mahi Mahi, shrimp, and scallops.   Not as much rice as the other burritos, this uses more lettuce.  Topped with a special cream sauce.

This thing is delicious.  So now, I'll eat this for the next 5 years and then pick another item to try from their menu.  HAHAHA!
author: Denise M.

description:
I came here yesterday for lunch and luckily we came really early because the restaurant was completely full by noon.  The menu is very extensive which made it hard to choose but I ended up ordering a chicken flauta and chile relleno.  The chips and salsa were bottomless, I loved the salsa because it tasted very fresh and it was spicy but the chips were pretty stale.  It tasted that they were made in the restaurant though.

The food came out very quickly and I liked how they gave me a huge side of jalapenos for free.  The flauta was delicious, it had an amazing sauce and it was a very generous portion.  I had never tried chile relleno but I personally don't like it very much.  I love peppers but I didn't enjoy the soggyness that surrounded it.  The rice and the beans were delicious, and I finished it all.  

I think it's a good place to come for lunch and it's pretty solid for the Mexican food.  It's also pretty cheap for the amount of food you get!
author: Rachel L.

description: So so good. Just tried their chicken and beef enchiladas. Amazing! My favorite are crispy beef tacos. But I encourage you to try enchiladas!
author: Honest Y.

description:
Since I don't live in the Mission and I have been on a burrito kick for months, I figured it was time to find an awesome burrito joint close to home. And that I did find at Orale Orale! Alright Alright!!
Within walking distance from my place so that is a bonus,I am almost tempted to give it five stars just for that. 
I had the veggie burrito of course. Packed with just the basic veggie ingredients that I like:beans, rice, cheese, salsa and guac. Good, chewy tortilla. Basic and yummy. Thats how I like my burritos. And cheapo as well.....
author: Kelley D.

description:
I just don't get it.  

Lines flood out of this place every single day.  And for what?  Very mediocre Mexican food, that's what.  

The only thing Orale knows how to do is mask their food with inch-thick layers of cheese.

Wait, I take it back.  They have another skill too.

They know how to charge an arm and a leg for a pitcher of margaritas.  Even though we FiDi workers like to have a cocktail during lunch from time to time, I don't think it's right to charge $30 dollars for margaritas..and made with Jose Cuervo, no less!  

Or is that just the stingy Asian woman in me thinking out loud?

Their complimentary chips and salsa are not bad though.
author: Diane L.

description:
Best breakfast burritos ever!

If you're getting lunch, make sure you get in line by 11:45.  Pretty much everything on the menu is great.
author: Lulu P.

description:
The portions are big enough for two. It was the usual lunch escapades with the bf today, and after getting fed up with the line at Les Croissants, we entered Dos Orales with a line out the door for take-away. We spent perhaps 10 minutes altogether, which is not so bad.

I ordered one of their house specialties, the Chili Verde Burrito. It's certainly the best burrito I've had in a while. I don't eat Mexican much on account of the lard/carb/protein heavy meals, but every once in a while I indulge.

I don't like refried beans either (*GASP, THE SHOCK, THE HORROR*), but here I was, scooping up fork-fulls and stuffing it into my piehole. The rice was decent, but the true star on my plate was the moist and savory pork loin chunks stewed with chili verde sauce and then wrapped in a flour tortilla.

I could only eat half of the meal (am saving the other half for lunch tomorrow!), and I am STUFFED. Orale served some kickin' salsa, too.

Prices aren't cheap, but you can fill your tummy with goodness for under $10 with a number of entrees offered. 

Try the Chili Verde Burrito. You can thank me later, my friends.
author: May T.

description:
The salsa is super good and super spicy. Yes, this may cause you to have to leave work early. And yes, you knew that before you ate three bowls worth of the salsa. So when you are in your meeting with your boss and the important client, and all of a sudden it is a life or death decision between sitting in your chair like a god damn idiot with sweat rolling down your temples, and taking a 20 minute bathroom break after which you come back and find you are now fired, remember that the salsa was EFFING GOOD.

My favorite thing to get is the enchiladas. One beef, one chicken. Pardon my mundane choice, but simplicity is a virtue. Gandhi knew. Although he wouldn't have ordered the beef. He would have had two chicken enchiladas.

The service is excellent. The food is filling and cheap. And as you sit in your chair playing mine sweeper and drifting off from about 1-2:30pm you will wonder: Was there any downside? And when you are hooked up to an IV 50 years from now sitting in the ICU because triple bypass heart surgery was required due to excessive amounts of cholesterol buildup in your arteries, you'll think for a moment, and then... you'll blame it on bad genes.
author: Richard S.

description: I used to eat here pretty frequently. They have a mean wet seafood burrito. I love wet burritos. I don't eat Mexican food very often, but I don't think I've ever seen a burrito with white sauce anywhere else. There are few Mexican spots that do it for me, this is one of them.
author: Erika C.

description: Closest place for a good burrito not named Rubios in the Embarcadero that is not $$$$. I usually sit down to eat on my late lunch breaks here. The service is top notch in the dinning area. I had the Carne Asada burrito supremo (usually) and fish tacos. Both were very good. The chips and salsa are addicting like a crackhead feigning for crack. The carne asada was good. Better than the food truck across my building, so that's another reason why I come here. Do yourself a favor and come here anytime before or after 12pm...
author: Jeff C.

description:
ORALE ORALE
One of the most interesting Mexican restaurants I've ever been to, in that they make seafood burritos unlike any other!!! Located on the Embarcardero, this Mexican restaurant stands out because of the long lines during the lunch hour. There is a sitting area in the restaurant, but it's very difficult to get seating if you don't get there early. I ordered the seafood burrito (mahi mahi) and was surprised when they served it to me in a aluminum circle takeout container. The burrito was sitting inside on top of a bed of white and savory sauce. A wet burrito, this one required knife and fork, but dang, it tasted good!!! The only drawback to Orale Orale is that you have to pay for chips and salsa.... boo hoo! But the burritos are worth it, so get there early!
author: Stanley C.

description: Best mexican food i've found in the area so far.  Al Pastor plate is really good.  Gets really crowded around lunch so get there at 11:30 or after the lunch rush if you want a table
author: Daniel M.

description:
I'm no executive chef, nor an expert on mexican food, but since when is water a key ingredient to Nachos?  We got our chicken nachos and there was literally a 1/4 inch of water on the entire bottom of the plate.  The nachos also had parmesan cheese on it, no, I'm not mistaking it for that other really good mexican cheese, this was actual parmesan, it says so on the menu.  The Nachos also didn't have guac or sour cream, just really odd. 

I also went with a combo plate and tried to play it safe by getting a taco and a burrito.  The burrito was supposed to be pork and that's exactly what it was, pork with a tortilla wrapped around it, no other ingredients at all!  Unreal.  I was really disappointed.  Then the enchilada sauce had like nutmeg or something in it.  It was really sweet and weird.  They didn't even have the good mexican coke in the bottle with the real sugar in it. 

This place made subway smell awesome after we ate at this place.  Avoid it at all costs!
author: Kanoa B.

description:
Score.

I came here for lunch on St. Patty's Day of all days (and I'm even Irish) and it was awesome.  The line looks crazy long, but it moves crazy fast.  My coworker and I were seated in less than 5 minutes.

The food is pretty good and cheap.  For being in FiDi I'm even more impressed.  I'll totally go back.
author: Jen K.

description: Pricey, financial district prices. I had crab enchilada and it was ok. Would try other stuff.
author: Yoko S.

description: I would have given Orale Orale four stars after my first lunch there -- if I hadn't gone back for a breakfast burrito. The restaurant has apparently discovered the only source in the country for chorizo that has absolutely no flavor whatsoever -- I felt like I was eating a burrito imported from a senior citizen's center somewhere in the Midwest. Stick to lunch and you'll be fine, though (especially if you "cut" the line by ordering take-out)!
author: Michael D.

description: I just now tried a chicken supremo burrito from Orale Orale...BOMB! It tastes very fresh, it's HUUUUUUGE, and it was ready in no time. I've been going to Caramba for mexican food cravings for a while now, but this place is way better. Very decently priced too! The only reason I take away one star is because they don't have a salsa bar...that's a huge necessity for me!
author: Dawn O.

description:
I vaguely recall getting a take out burrito here before and it being fairly good... but I went today for a quesadilla and was disappointed.

on the positive side, the salsa with the chips had a good level of spice.

I ordered a vegetarian quesadilla expecting that it would have vegetables in it.  it was just plain cheese.  the cheese wasn't entirely melted.  and it was one kind of cheese.  It wasn't bad, really with melted (well mostly) cheese you can't go wrong, but I've had better.
author: Nedra D.

description: I've been going to Orale Orale for over 16 years. It's great and has a massive lunch time crowd. The food is always fresh. They have the best enchiladas in the city, the chips and salsa are perfect, and the chimichangas are very good. They serve great margarita's. occasionally I'll stop by in the morning and have huevos con chorizo and that is awesome too. Best Mexican food in the city.
author: Darren S.

description:
Wow!  I'm really surprised at all negative comments!  If it's any indication of how good a place is by how packed they are, forget about going after 12pm.  Lines are out the door.  Even if you order beforehand, there is still a wait, or at least a bit of struggle getting through the crowds to get to the counter.

I've been going here for years, and they have the best chicken burrito supremo, for a $5.25!  That is CHEAP by Financial District standards!   And when it's described as "supremo," you betcha it's a big one!  They also have an excellent chicken omelet with the works - I usually have them hold the beans (definitely not a bean person), and add extra rice & hash browns to the order.  So big I don't usually need to eat until dinnertime.  (Note: they do charge an extra 20% after 10:30am for breakfast items.  Only found out from reading the fine print!)

Orale's is so good that whenever I order, I have to bring an extra back to my husband.  We normally don't eat a lot of Mexican food , because they are all chains out here in our area, like Chili's - yuck - so this is a treat.  I would eat her all the time if I had the metabolism of my toddler son.

Only reason it isn't 5 stars is the place is kind of a hole in the wall, and they screwed up my takeout a few times.  But it's usually when it's super busy, so I understand (although it's a bit of annoying b/c it's not something I can check until I get back to the office).  Aside from that, yum-e-yum-yum.
author: Anna S.

description: This place grew on me after a while.  It gets a bit too crowded during the lunch rush, but it's downtown and sit down.  The staff is hilariously nice and the food is good.  Everything is above average for enjoyability (sodas are small, but I drink a huge amount of soda).  The food is good and consistent, a good place for boisterous lunch conversation.  With all the amazing mexican in SF it's hard to say the place is perfect, but for the location it's great.
author: Josh Z.

description: When feeling for a burrito I do make my way here for lunch, it's the only close burrito joint within walking distance from my work in 1 hour of lunch time.  It's pretty small, and when lunch time hits the line can form straight out the door.  It has one flat screen that usually shows soccer and the place can get a bit loud.  I would typically get the super carne asada burrito w/ everything.  I am so not shy when it comes to burritos.  The portion is pretty huge, decent enough to take half home for a light dinner.  Well for me, of course.  Before your food comes out they do serve chips and salsa and the prices are not bad.
author: Becky U.

description:
I used to go to Orale with a buddy of mine at least twice a month for years when I worked up the street.  Started coming here because the chile rellanos were one of the best I ever had.  The pepper wasn't mushy, not hard, the cheese was always gooey, the batter neither soggy nor crisp, but, just right.

I went back the other day with an old co-worker to try my old haunt, and, just like in times past, I wasn't disappointed.  I had a combo with a chile relleno sidecar - I was in heaven.  Luckily through the years, I have realized that a lunch of this magnitude cannot be a one-meal deal - it must be good for two meals otherwise a human resemblance to the Hindenberg would ensue.

Love the cute joint, love the food.
author: Johnny L.

description:
I'd give this place 3.5 stars if I could, but I'll round up because I'm all about the food.  The food is good and the salsa actually has a little kick to it.  The burritos are definitely on the moister side, so those that prefer dry burritos should avoid this place.  While the food is good, there are some peculiarities about this place.

1) They charge significantly more to sit down.  A relatively cheap burrito for the FiDi becomes pretty expensive when you sit down.
2) They charge you for jalapenos.  Seriously, that should be against the law.

While the food is above average, this place is actually the best Mexican joint in the FiDi, which is just sad.
author: Daniel J.

description:
I would have originally given this place 1 star based on their burritos.

However, due to its proximity to my place of employment I was essentially forced to give it another chance.

Now the GOOD PART, I tried some other things on the menu and they don't suck(see below)!

Fajitas - Very Solid 4 stars (would be 5 stars if they didn't charge extra for things like black beans or an extra salsa)
Burrito - to reiterate 1 star (watery and chinsy on the meat)
Specialty Meats (Pastor and Carnitas) - 4 stars (these are only available on certain days of the week and remember avoid weak ass burrito)
Chile Relleno - 3 stars (good but not great)
Breakfast Burrito - 4 stars (the only burrito that doesn't suck!)
Pollo Ranchero - 5 stars (Monday's special, this was spot on when I tried it the other day, solid flavor)
Chips and Salsa - 1 and 4 respectively (get better chips!!! the salsa is very good)
