They have two lines - one to sit and one to go so we opted to go.  The food was up quick and we headed over to the Embarcadero for a table.  I had a burrito that was pretty good.  My boyfriend had the friend chicken which was the special of the day and it was special.  It was spicy and delicious - and I kept eating off his plate.  I remember coming here once before and eating inside which I would prefer.  Next time I will have to get there early!
author: Arica V.

description: This is a decent place for mexican food near the embarcadero and the prices are not bad. The food does taste better than pepe's taqueria which is about five blocks away from this place. If you're craving mexican food near the embarcadero I would suggest orale orale or Rubio's and avoid Pepe's
author: Lawrence F.

description:
I had the Chile Verde burrito and it wasn't very good -- kinda bland. Usually when I get a Chile Verde burrito I expect a lot of hot verde salsa, but I didn't get any here (and was disappointed). 

Maybe this place is great if you're from the east coast, but I'm from San Diego and this place is average. I'll being going back to try something more discerning like the ceviche or enchiladas.
author: Alex P.

description: their steak quesadilla is absolutely amazing! It's the best I've ever had at a reasonable cost and a large portion.
author: Jen P.

description: I came in for lunch and got the seafood enchiladas. The beans and rice tasted very generic. They were not bad, just generic. The seafood enchiladas tasted good. The seafood tasted fresh, though a little dry. The cheese sauce that it was smothered it was a little bland, I would have liked it to taste a little bolder. The chips and salsa were good. I felt the dish was reasonably priced. Not sure if I would come back again though as I am used to a different style.
author: Gerard C.

description:
healthy serving size, immediate service, and acceptable tastes.  

made for a great to-go meal for the Justin Herman Plaza. 

I may be back, but it's nothing to write home about.
author: Mason S.

description:
I had to say I did frequent this place about once every two weeks for about 1 years. My husband works near this restaurant so sometimes we would meet up for lunch. The food is nothing special it was ok but not too bad. Some of the meet in the tacos and nachos seemed to be reheated and made the texture tough and dry. The older gentleman that works there ( sorry i don't know his name) Was always very nice and attentive ( he was one of the reason why we went back ...because he was friendly and helpful.) . The rest of the staff seemed to be a bit rude and distant. That did not seem to bother me at first but visit after visit it got a bit worst. Sometime the t.v was so loud and staff was so distracted by what was on that they would take a long time to take our order. The girl by the cash register and some of her coworker were alway so busy talking very loud about inappropriate thing in spanish. The last straw was when on our last visit we had to wait about 20 minute for some one to take our order. ( even though there was 4 people there as staff and about 2 other customers only) We ended up walking out and never going back. 

Good chips and salsa!
author: Karen F.

description: Big, tasty burritos.  And the salsa is amazing.  I've now taken to ordering food to go...short wait, but much shorter than for getting a table.
author: Tim S.

description:
Hey! I can see this place from my office window!
But that's not the ONLY thing Orale Orale has going for it.
I've now been to Orale the minimum requisite number of times (4 or more) and can now form an opinion (assuming enough coffee and liquor).  
Point the first: at lunchtime it's always crowded.  What does that tell you?  Besides that it's in the SF financial district, I mean.  
Point the second: The massive burrito supremo (around $6, incl. tax).
As you feel the heft of one of these suckers lifting it off the counter you think: "There's NO WAY all of this can make it through my intestines."  But where would be the joy in life if you didn't try?  Didn't shoot the rapids?  Didn't explore the stars?  There's enough in one of these burritos to feed a family of 4, no doubt, but it's so fresh you wanna slap it!  There have been times when I couldn't get through a whole one, but it just makes another meal a few hours later.  
The downside: When you order take-out you get no chips.  What's up with that?  C'mon Orale, do you want 5 stars or not?
Get there.  Get the burrito or whatever else you want.  Feel the heft that's in your gullet equal the heft that's still in your wallet.
Tell 'em Jimmy sent ya.
author: James B.

description:
A coworker calls me on my cell phone, while I'm on a conference call  on my desk phone, so of course, I answer it,  multi-tasking goddess that I am.   (*Note* this is also the time when those on the call decide to ask me a question and after a quick scramble, I mumble something about being on mute and no one heard me talking...so much for multi-tasking!) 

 "Hey," she says, "Want to join me and Kara for enchiladas?"  Ok, I admit I had been thinking about soup or salad for lunch as a trip to Florida is in the near future and enchiladas are not the first thing that comes to mind when trying to lose a few pounds to fit into your bathing suit.

"So where you heading?" I ask.  "Orale Orale" she says, "I've never been there before, but Kara says she needs something that makes her happy today, so we're going there."    

"Really? I love that place, but I'm on a conference call, about to wrap up. Can you wait five or ten minutes?"

"No girl, Kara says we've got to go right now, we'll meet you there!" (Time is 11:40 am).  "Ok!" I say.

Back to the conference call..."Hey guys" I break in, "I've got to jump off the call, something just came up."  Next thing they know, they're hearing my "now departing" message from the call. 

So, to hell with the soup or salad, enchiladas it is!  I take those three blocks like an Olympic speed walker. But damn, why did I wear my boots today with the three inch heels? I get there at 11:47 am and the place is packed, but they've already got a table.  Whew!

OK, so I usually get a burrito, which I agree is probably the best in the FiDi since Si Senor closed.  But I never had the enchiladas and was in for a nice surprise.  I ordered the cheese enchiladas, and damn they are tasty!  The sauce is sweet and the two of them were seemingly inhaled, I barely remember chewing!  The service is great and quick, and all very friendly.  One server joked with me about being late, as I was rushing to the open seat at their table.   

I mostly avoid the lunch crowd because I'm not patient about waiting to eat (I'm hungry damn it!), but if you get there before 11:45 you should be able to get a seat.   Most of my visits are after work, before heading to one of my professional group meetings, when there's not much of a crowd.  Oh, and the frozen strawberry margaritas are equally tasty and strong, and are perfect for getting me though an evening of networking and schmoozing.
author: Darcy R.

description:
Quite possibly the worst burrito I've ever had.  No taste and the rice was old and smelly (but not in a good way).  The restuarant itself is dark and unappealing.

People will tell you their enchiladas are great, but I guess I'll never know since I won't be going back there.
author: Adam W.

description: I've been eating at this little Mexican eatery for years!!!  The last two times (two months) I have eaten here has been a disaster.  There must be changes in the kitchen as the food has turned to slop.  I'm not going back.
author: Denise P.

description: My family has been eating here for years so I write about this place with a nostalgic lens.  i have had a lot here thru the years and only discovered that it's not mind-blowing, but slid solid fare.  And that's okay by me.
author: Victor M.

description: crowded but good, good drinks, good food
author: Michael E.

description:
To be fair, the price was right: $5.25 for a fully-loaded burrito in the Financial District is unbeatable.  Also, the service was quick, and the people working there were nice, but...

The burrito just didn't taste that good - as in, it tasted like everything in it had come from a can.   Now, the menu was expansive, so maybe I didn't order the right thing.  But, from my experience, the "never judge a book by its cover" saying doesn't exactly translate into "never judge a Mexican restaurant by its chicken burrito", does it?
author: Daniel S.

description:
I am admittedly a relative novice to Mexican food, however, I think that makes me even more qualified to judge these restaurants because I am not jaded by too many experiences.   I have worked in the Embarcadero Center for almost a year and always noticed a line outside this place, but didn't give it much thought until one afternoon when I left work mid-afternoon and was starving, and saw that at 2 p.m. there was no line, so dashed in, and was seated immediately.  I asked what the most popular orders were, and he said I was lucky in that being Friday I could order the Crab Enchilada.  It was luscious.  The chips were good, the salsa even better, and I practically licked the plate clean to taste all the sauce on the enchilada.  The following Monday I was back at the office, full of raves  for Orale, and my colleagues all rolled their eyes -- they were already converts.  I was miffed that none of them had yet introduced me!  To think I'd been foostering with Chevy's (where I do admit to a fondness for the frozen margaritas).   So to cut to the chase, have returned several times, tried the chicken enchiladas (thus far, my M-Th favorite), the chimchangas (good, but not a favorite), the rellenos, the flautas, and the burritos, all excellent.   I still think Cancun makes the best foiled burritos, but Orale's are quite good.  I shared the chicken quesadilla with a friend and it was nice, although she did not like the onions.  Prices, especially given the financial district location, are reasonable -- each entree is under $10 and is accompanied by rice and beans, and endless baskets of tortilla  triangles and salsa.  

I do believe Orale sets a high standard other Mexican establishments must meet to be included in my Yelp reviews, and so far have not found anything better in San Francisco.
author: Joanie F.

description: Good food.  No complaints.  Very busy.  It is a bit expensive but it is San Francisco.
author: Esper G.

description:
Ahhhhhh Orale Orale....  This review is years overdue but nevertheless it must be said.

I used to frequent Orale when I worked across the street, maybe once every week or two for about a year.  The food is not the best but it was convenient to run in and pick up a "baby burrito". 

One day I met up with a couple of friends who had walked from the other side of the FiDi for some lunch.  One of my friends wanted Mexican food so I suggested Orale (since it was the only Mexican food in the area).  We are seated and proceed to order:

Waiter - What would you like to order?
Me - Can I get a baby burrito?
Waiter - No, you cant order the baby burrito only the regular burrito.
Me - ??
Waiter - If you sit down in here you cant order the baby burrito otherwise we wont make money.
Me - If I pay the regular burrito price can I just get the baby burrito
Waiter - No
Me - Ooookkkayy, I guess I'll just take the regular burrito.

All was fine until we hear from the kitchen "spit in that order".  Our whole table pauses and looks.  The waiter is talking to the cook and pointing directly at us.  Now I'm going to pause for a second here to say, if you're going to spit in someone's food A.) Do it yourself.  And B.) Do it in a manner hidden from public view.  This way you can get away with punishing a "difficult customer".  Anyways, he was so blatant with it that other tables heard as well.

We should have just gotten up and left the place but we had the courtesy to cancel our orders.  The manager came out and asked "is there a problem here?" half heartedly trying to resolve the issue so we would stay and eat but he was a bit to late on that.

I have not been back to this place since and I will continue to recommend to everybody I know, unless you want a spit burrito, don't eat here.
author: Nate W.

description:
I haven't been to Orale Orale in years. I guess it's ok for the FiDi, but there are just too many authentic taquerias with cheaper prices to choose from in the city. 

Anyway, this is for their weekly Thursday  special fried chicken only. First, the chicken was cold and dry. The skin wasn't even crispy! Hello. FRIED chicken is supposed to be CRISPY.  There was no batter. No crispy flour coating on the chicken. It was as if they simply seasoned it a little and then skillet fried it. 
It was even a little burnt in certain spots. I think the worst thing was I specified which pieces I wanted. Did you know you don't get to choose?! She basically told me "you just get whatever we give you.", not in a mean way. But Really?? Suppose you want to give me the chicken head? I don't like chicken head.  Granted they gave me two huge pieces, both wing and breast. But who cares how big it is if  the meat is dry. I guess the only redeeming quality is that it had good flavoring. Just enough salt w/o being too salty. Would have appreciated some pepper, but the hint of curry was a very good touch. 
All in all, I wouldn't order their fried chicken ever again. It simply wasn't worth the $7.00 the cashier insisted was the price for both the Ala Carte *and* the complete dinner.. I didn't want the beans, rice, etc. For $7.00 I could've fed myself for a week at Popeye's or even KFC. Yes people, KFC's extra crispy is better than Orale's chicken. Stick to the Mexican themed items if you go there.
author: Sheba B.

description: Stumbled upon here by accident and had the seafood burrito supremo. It was excellent- it was so delicious, I couldn't stop myself from eating even though it was full. The queso sauce smothered on top of it was amazing. Great price for a great, generous sized burrito.
author: Pam C.

description:
San Francisco is a burrito city, so the bar is set high. Unfortunately, Orale Orale has fallen through the char-grilled cracks on many levels. Given the downtown (financial district) location, I expected this but decided to give it a shot anyhow.  The menu, which lacks a vegetarian section, only offers one option for meat-free burritos and it's the "Vegetarian Supremo" for $5.25. The Veg Supremo has 8 ingredients (rice, beans, cheese, lettuce, tomato, green onion, sour cream and guac). I like things simple so I ordered a burrito with rice, beans, cheese and salsa (4 ingredients), which came to $5.70. So for subtracting 4 ingredients I was charged an additional 45 cents. Add a can of diet coke and the whole thing was $7.20, which is just insane in vegetarian burrito land. Looking at the menu, I see that the for the same cost ($5.25) the Burrito Supremo offeres everything the Veg Supremo offers, only they add chicken, ground beef, port orsteak. So for budget burrito eaters like myself , this makes no sense. 

And they don't even give you chips! There was extra salsa in the bag, but no chips! The loosely folded package was sad and lumpy. The salsa was hot, but there was nothing to dunk. This was my first and last trip to Orale Orale.
author: Stumbalina b.

description: I absolutely LOVE this place!  Their food in Mexican, not California, San Francisco, fancy Mexican fusion you see all over the city.  This food is a little soggy and the portions are huge.  The service is very friendly and prompt.  Fridays, they offer crab for an extra $2 and it's really good crab.
author: Otto D.

description: Normally, this place has decent Mexican food, but I went last week and had their enchiladas.  This is how they make their enchiladas:  they roll up some meat in corn tortillas, spoon sauce over them, and nuke them.  Needless to say, they were not that tasty--yucky.
author: C L.

description: I ordered my shrimp burrito here and did not find one shrimp in it. Guess who is never going back there?
author: Weezy F.

description: I've been intruiged by the long lines at this place for a while, so decided to try it today.....Meh, seriously nothing special. The carne was a bit tough, salsa not really up to par, and overall just nothing special. The price is a bit high also.....$11 for a burrito?  No thanks, Tlaloc is much better.
author: C R.

description: Don't eat breakfast because you're going to want to get here around 11:15 to beat the lunch rush.  Food is great.  The salsa is spicy and constantly refilled.  The service here is excellent. You will get your food less than 10 minutes after you order it.
author: Jackie A.

description: So I didn't have a "signature dish" but I did sample a wet chicken buritto and the steak quesadilla. The place isn't bad but doesn't scream 5 stars. I wish Yelp would do half stars beacuse it would technically rate be a 3.5. There are two lines when you enter, table service and take out. They both moved pretty quickly. The table service was what you would expect from a "hole in the wall" joint. The buritto was moist and pretty good. The steak quesadilla was ok. The meat seemed to be... uh kinda chewy. Overall the experience was a good one and would like to venture out and try other things off their menu. I'd love to see what breakfast has to offer. I'll keep you posted. Thanks for reading, Silvia
author: Silvia S.

description: I'm from San Antonio and know good mexican food, both Tex-Mex and real Mexican. So far out here in Cali, it's alright, not great, not horrible either. So that said, I am very biased when it comes to Mexican food. Maybe I'm just partial to south Texas Mexican food. I had the cheese enchiladas and my wife had the crab enchiladas. The cheese enchiladas were the worse I have ever had. There are road side stands in SA that blow them away. The crab enchiladas were not edible. I really like crab but could not stand the taste of these. The salsa was good, actually spicy and the margaritas were worth it. I would give one star but the two stars are for the salsa, the margarita, and because my taste is biased.
author: Wes K.

description: I absolutely love this place! I actually dream of their chicken enchiladas at night and this is at the top of my list of favorite mexican restaurants in the city.  The enchilada sauce is sooooooo delish!  I have actually here for lunch and dinner in the same day, that's gotta say something:)
author: Jennifer P.

description: It's the only decent Mexican restaurant I've found in the FiDi.  Lunch does get super busy, so go early or late.  Good veggie options, and --even more important-- a great cheese enchilada plate with green sauce!
author: Andi T.

description:
orale orale is your run of the mill, slightly better than most, mexican joint.  i'm usually a mexican food snob (not eating much outside of san diego), but i guess i'm a victim of circumstance as this is the best mexican joint for when i'm working in the FiDi.

positives:
chips and salsa waiting for you when you sit down
pretty extensive menu

negatives:
gets pretty full during lunch time (get there at 1130 or earlier if you can)
price is slightly higher than it should be

overall, if you want some sit-down mexican in the FiDi, hit up orale, but don't expect mission-quality food (or prices).
author: dan a.

description: This place is actually on Sacto just around the corner from Drumm across from the Embarcadero Center. I always come here when getting eats before seeing a movie at the EC. No frills Mexican but very fast service and good prices. I think they replaced our tortilla chips 3 times in the span of 15 minutes - same with the salsa which has a kick. I can recommend the fish tacos with "special sauce". If you're in a rush and need to satisfy your appetite this is the place to go - I've never been for lunch but I hear it gets kinda busy.
author: Colin S.

description: I heart this place. The best mexican food in the FiDi. Big portions! In my quest to find something on the menu I would call my "regular order", I constantly fail because everything I've had here so far has been pretty damn spectacular. They have friendly servers and quick service too. There are long lines during the lunch hour so if you want to be seated quick come before 12 or after 1. Or you can just do take-out.
author: LM M.

description:
no dice.
never thought it would be so hard to find decent mexican food in the FiDi. this place is definitely not an option, the people who line up for this place, are obviously here on business and wont go back.  Ive been here twice and both times it was boring and just not good. the chicken in my burrito was scary and flavorless, even the chips/salsa were bad. Pancho Villa on the Embarcadero or Tlaloc are more superior options if you cant make it to the Mish for the real deal. Colibri is also good for a sit-down bistro-flare mex meal. . .
author: Ashleigh G.

description:
my favorite mexican restaurant in the bay area!!  

located only a few blocks from my office so i always take it to go to avoid the long wait for a table (although, that means i have to buy chips & salsa, but i'm okay with that).

their ground beef is sensuously seasoned and includes bits of potato.  love it!  

their salsa is chunky and w/ just the right amount of spice.  lurve it!

their rice is not seasoned, which i appreciate bc it doesn't take away from the flavors of the other items in the meal.  lub it!

this is the only place i'll order an enchilada... just so i can lap up the secret sauce of the nuns who devised it.  mouth-watering tasty!  loooove it!
author: Carol O.

description: After a long work out, I often treat myself to Orale Orale's seafood burrito. It's a wet burrito filled with seafood smothered with an creamy sauce. What better way to ruin a work out then to gorge yourself on a million calories? All I can say is YUM!
author: Chum L.

description: Okay, okay. I was wrong about this place when I first ate here over two years ago. Coming from LA and being surrounded by great Mexican food, at first Orale was not my hombre. I thought the shredded beef burrito that I ordered was to soggy and runny. Now at present time, I have been coming here periodically because the Chimichanga, ROCKS, as well as the services. I still do not like their shredded burrito because it does not have enough meat to make me happy although it's not runny nor soggy anymore.
author: Kathy T.

description: You can get in and out of this place for lunch in less than 15 minutes if you have the inclination, but you have to get there early, because this place gets busy. Even when the line is long, the wait typically isn't. Danny and Alex take good care of every guest and the food is terrific. I highly recommend the surf and turf, a carne asada steak with butterflied shimp under some sort of amazing creamy gravy with rice and beans. The crispy chicken tacos are always delicious too. Prices are about 25-50% below what they should be in the financial district. They are open M-F until 7 or 8. Never been early, but they have a good looking breakfast menu as well. OH, and don't forget they have a full bar, just in case you crave a margarita in the middle of the day!
author: Scott S.

description:
Here's a sad fact .. in over a year and a half's time of going here I never got anything but the Chicken Enchilada at lunchtime, I mean, it was *that* good!  I no longer work in the city and I just get all misty eyed thinking about how I might never get a chance to eat here again (sniff).  I love the salsa here, so much that I often bought containers of it to eat for snacks.  It's really amazing that I haven't had better salsa than Orale Orale's.  
The restaurant is always crowded at lunchtime but the efficient serving staff keep the tables moving (so long as the patrons aren't clueless and loiter after eating).  Ordering food to go is interesting when it's busy: there are 3 chairs to have a seat while you wait but since it's up against the wall you get to look straight into the line of other people ordering to go who are di-rectly in front of you .. where do you look?  I hated this game so I usually just waited outside the door and listened for my order.
author: Ed P.

description: It seems like a good deal.  Quick (if you get it to go) Mexican at the tip of financial district.  Its relatively cheap too!  But then you look inside the burrito and there is no meat.  Also, I seem to get major stomach aches afterwards.......
author: Marcus E.

description: Thank you Orale Orale - for introducing me to the Chile Colorado burrito, and for those mid-day margaritas, and for those mexican coke's in a bottle and for staying open for dinner on weeknights, and for having the just right salsa, and the crab (only on friday) enchiladas and for being across the street from my old gig at 4 Embarcadero.
author: D S.

description:
this is my favorite mexican lunch place of all time.  i order only one thing.........the pork enchiladas with verde sauce.  yummy!!

UPDATE 5/21/08:  Another awesome experience.  I went here with a coworker for a quick chat and eats.  Since they don't have a website, I can't really "cut and paste" what I ate, so here goes:  Today I had the "one enchilada" platter, a cheese enchilada with chile verde sauce, refried beans and rice $8.95.  You can choose between a chicken, beef, pork or cheese enchilada.  Of course, as scrumptious as I can remember (it's be awhile) and I ate every last morsel.  

My tummy is still full from the experience.  Always a guaranteed "thumbs up".
author: Brenda H.

description: Spicy salsa, ginormous burritos and a bottomless basket of chips. I'd move in, but I think I'd be pushing 2 bills stat. It's a little crazy during the lunch rush, but I find that the line moves pretty quickly. Grilled Chicken Supremo Burrito, por favor!
author: Marie M.

description: Help support the nuns of Morelia! Those ladies know how to make one kick ass enchilada sauce. Your choice of chicken, ground beef or cheese. They are delicious served with rice and beans. The chips at this place kinda suck (not homemade and pretty stale) and the salsa is HELLA hot. If you're into that, it's cool. Otherwise just save room for the enchies. MMMMMMMMMMMM!
author: Katelin H.

description: So happy this place is next to my office. But it's really busy on most of the days. Hope the new Chipotle doesn't put this place out of business.
author: Joon L.

description: 5 stars for the category it falls in. Great mexican restaurant food. Fresh food, fresh taste. Super fast excellent wait staff. Great taste.
author: Joseph W.

description: I am trippin'....I've had an office right there in the same block as Orale Orale, and I still take a taxi to eat somewhere else when I craved Mexican Food.  Maybe it seems fresh to many people, but I believe it's because the food is BLAND.  I can understand why the prices are above average for Mexican places in this part of The City, but I've walked all the way to El Faro to avoid this place and get better quality Mexican food for like a dollar less per item. The FiDi's selection of Mexican food joints is not the greatest, so just to let you know. I gave it an extra star ONLY because the Salsa is good...But I don't see the value of a $7 burrito in which I get more & better for $5 elsewhere.
author: Gio G.

description: Went Orale Orale for lunch today and had the Friday special Crab enchiladas, the food is so good. I wish the lines weren't so long so I can go there more often, but it's a popular place in the financial district. If you have the extra time it's worth it! And I heard the drinks are good too!
author: G A.

description: I love this place. The salsa is sooooo good. Nice and spicy.  The chips could be a little crispier, but the salsa makes up for it.  The dishes are good too, but the salsa just makes everything so much better.  Long wait during lunch hours, so get there early.
author: Tinou B.

description: I don't have a bad thing to say about this place, except that I wish they had more seating! It's KEY to get there around 11:45 to beat the rush and get a table before everyone shows up. It's also perfect for take-out. The original chimichunga is delish! My absolute favorite! The rice and beans are SO good as well! Everyone who works near this place knows how good it is, and it shows by the line which streams out the door on a daily basis.
author: Guy F.

description: I finally met colleagues for dinner at Orale Orale after spending 2.5 years walking past the storefront several times a week. I started the meal with the customary chips, spicy salsa and a margarita. As usual, I was pretty full by the time the meal came. I ordered a vegetarian burrito which was both filling and flavorful. The meal was nothing to rave about, but was great with a margarita and good conversation. I would go back, but with more social than gastronomical expectations.
author: Charles B.

description:
What can I say, I have been going to Orale Orale since 1998 and I have never never been disappointed. 

Their burrito supremo con pollo is amazing. It is juicy to the extreme. (I never get it with sour cream or cheese.) 

Their crab enchiladas are delicate. 

And their chips and Salsa (spicy) never miss. 

You can't beat great reasonably priced Mexican food! Especially in the Embarcadero!
author: Peppe R.

description: I used to go to Orale at least once a week for delish Mexican food (chile verde is off the charts) and a yummy margarita.  The salsa is fresh and delicious and has a good kick to it - not pre-fab, weak salsa like some places.  The service is fast and friendly and if you're a regular you might even get a margarita while you wait for your table (not that I would know...).  The Thursday special of the day - fried chicken - is so delish that I think I'm becoming an addict.  It is so much better than MY fried chicken I am a bit resentful and bitter and have completely stopped cooking fried chicken - why should I??  Now I have to go twice a week - once for Mexican food and once for the chicken - get there early (they sell out by 12:30)...but if you're in front of me and get the last chicken order you'd better watch your back!  The portion is huge so if you're not a glutton like me you could split it with a friend - but will have to fight over breast/wing or thigh/leg.  Mmmmm, is it Thursday yet??
author: Wendy B.

description: Best juevos rancheros ever, and I've been all over the bay area.  That is all.
author: Dave H.

description: The salsa is uh-may-sing. It's all I can do not to eat lunch here every single day. And the staff is so nice - very clearly a family-run establishment with great unfussy Mexican food.
author: Kate R.

description: I get my burrito grind every week from Orale and it's got to be good if I keep going back.  The only problem is you're full for the rest of the day... I recently found out that if you grab a burrito at 11:00 you beat the lunch line, otherwise it's out the door.
author: Alex R.

description: There are some days when I tire of lunch al'desko but I also don't have an hour and a half to blow on lunch -- that's where Orale Orale comes in: chips and salsa, tableside service and piping hot Mexican food, all in half an hour flat. Extra bonus stars for the delicious enchilada sauce, lightening quick call-in service for takeout orders, and staying open until 7 to feed the late night work crowd.
author: Heather F.

description: What is this place doing HERE?  In the FiDi-Embarcadero area?  What is with the cheap prices for a huge, mouth-watering burrito?  I mean, I don't even break a TEN for lunch?  That is madness!  I don't get it?  All these people in business suits bursting out the door just to either get a seat or take-out?  I mean, have those crazy aliens from Mars tired of crop circles and have now decided to just pluck taquerias from the Mission and plant them in the middle of tall high-rises?
author: Liz C.

description: Me gusta.  I'd give it 5 stars for the service alone. Then I'd give another 5 stars for the Mahi-Mahi ceviche. Then I'd give it another 5 stars for the soda served in to-go cups. The salsa was perfectly spicy, not  "ay yiyi spicy"  but in a "just like my abuela used to make" spicy (except my abuela grew up in Wisconsin). You will not be disappointed.
author: Jamie G.

description: Orale Orale is a really quick and easy lunch spot in the financial district.  I really liked the carne asada supremo!  The steak was very tasty and I love how guacamole is already included in the burrito.  By far the best burrito I've had in the fi-di.
author: Siu L.

description: I love their food but their service is so crappy. Their fax machine doesn't work.  The person taking orders over the phone doesn't understand English that well and put me on hold for a long time to find someone who can translate my order. I've asked for black beans twice on the phone (with the 1st order taker and THEN with the 2nd order taker). When I went to pick-up, I asked, "Are you sure you put black beans in the chicken burrito?"  Cashier looked at the receipt and said, "Yes."  When my boss opened the foil of her chicken burrito, she got PINTO beans! I'll give O.O. more stars when they get my order right.
author: Len B.

description: Had lunch here with co-workers. The food made up for the company, and the margaritas made up the rest of the afternoon. Yum. Loved it.
author: O'Nelly C.

description:
Well I can say that this place is definitely better than other Mexican restaurants in the area. Its probably the only Mexican restaurant in the area, unless you count Chevy's or Tlaloc, which aren't really Mexican. 

I like this place because they have a good selection of items, that are actually dishes my mom would cook, you know, real Mexican food, and not just a taco and a burrito. Food comes out heavy, greasy, cheesy, saucy, you know, the way it was meant to be. 

Place gets pretty crowded during lunch hours, but is quite tranquil otherwise. The staff is nice, and the food comes out quickly. Prices are also reasonable, for the portion you get.
author: A W.

description: After a few positive experiences my luck ran out when I found a toothpick and basil leaf cooked into my Chimichanga.  Needless to say, I took a break.  After about a month I figued I could give the Chimichanga a second chance which was my mistake.  I ended up food poisoning. I'm done with this place, Chimichangas and all.
author: Cameron H.

description: Good Mexican food with huuuuge burrito proportions.  The chips are addictively yummy, I especially like the non-salted ones, and the salsa was yummy too.  The long line moves surprisingly quickly and I was very impressed with the staff's handling of the bustling lunch time, rainy day crowd.  I know this will be the start of a long lunchtime relationship.
author: Debbie Y.

description: I love Orale Orale!  They are so accommodating there, never even batting an eyelash with all of my crazy substitutions and add ons.  I love getting breakfast (with some bacon on the side ifyouknowwhatimsaying) for lunch there with a nice, cold negra modelo.  Or a pitcher of margs to the dome!  Now that's alright!
author: Katie M.

description: This place is worth going! The seating gets filled fast, so just go to the take out line and bring your food outside to eat at the Embarcadero Center. Your order will be done before the person behind you is done ordering! This place defines in-and-out The food is great too. A good change from all the sandwich places around fidi.
author: Wendy L.

description: Can you survive eating EVERY meal here? I would try, if I thought my little half-Mexican heart could endure it. The beans are just like mi abuela used to make...I get a little teary-eyed just thinking about them. My ancestors would also HIGHLY approve of the enchiladas with the fab moralian sauce, carne asada anything, and for those times I really feel like living on the edge of a coronary, shredded beef corn flautas (deep fried, of course) smothered in guac and sour cream...yum! But the real achievement, in my humble opinion, is the ceviche tostadas...fresh fish chunks cooked in lime on a half shell...a masterpiece! There's a system to successfully eating here without waiting...breakfast (no crowd), lunch (call it in and pick it up), dinner (no crowd). My 1 teeny tiny complaint is the complaint of many...not open weekends.
author: Julia C.

description: me and meesh go here when we're feeling gluttonous.  But go early cuz it fills up.
author: Meg W.

description:
Sorry. Salsa is awesome, but chile relleno too squishy, bland, and old school for me.   Definitely satisfies if quantity is the goal. Burritos are huge and $8 for combo platter is pretty good deal.   Not the best Mexican food, but given lunch choices in FIDI not too bad.  So solid two star.  

I don't care for Mercedes, Los Socios is out of business and I only like Tlaloc for breakfast......
author: Mya P.

description: My most favorite burrito place EVER. Their enchiladas verdes and tacos are great too but nothing can beat their vegetarian or shredded beef supremo burritos. The salsa is my favorite too. The people in there are so nice and they always remember the regulars. Sometimes I have to wait a while for my take out order but it's so worth it. I would eat there everyday if I could guarantee that wouldn't make me 900 lbs.
author: Dana R.

description:
I've been going to Orale since they opened in 1989.  Once I had to stop going because the food got really bad.  After burning the quesadillas I ordered and kept burning them, I stopped going. Months later I ran into the manager and he said come back, we've changed cooks and the food is much better.  That was true and I continued going until recently.  The manager says I can't be pleased with anything.  Well, the food has gone down the hole again.  Today one of my favorite dishes the Shrimp Aurora which usually has a delicious creamy mushroom wine sauce was so watery and tasteless...the shrimp had no flavor and the rice and refried beans were so salty I couldn't eat those either.  The server who is their best cook was instead busy serving patrons when he should never do anything but cook.
As much as I like the entire family, and they always make me feel welcome even when I walk in there alone, l will not go there anymore. I will miss their margaritas.  Guess I'll have to make those at home from now on.
Let's hope they go through some drastic changes, again.
author: Nina P.

description: This place is so good and the staff is attentive and super friendly. It is neat and clean and consistent.
author: Hmmmmmm N.

description: The reason I am giving them ONE STAR! Is for their Crab Enchiladas...Those were the nastiest things I have ever eaten. Now mind you, everything else I've gotten from Orale Orale has been good. So my honey wanted a burrito and I thought oh, it's Friday I'll try the Crab Enchiladas! Worst mistake E V E R!!! There was bits of shell, the crab meat didn't even look anything like crab...UGH it was so so bad. I will eat there again, but you can best believe I will never EVER get the Crab Enchiladas AGAIN!!! EVER!!!!
author: L C.

description:
This is awesome, I've looked for 'al pastor" burritos all over FiDi and Orale Orale finally has them, not only do they have them but they are deliciosos! I don't have to go to the Mission to get them anymore. 

A couple of "rubias" (Modelo Especiales) and their great salsa and house made chips and I'm good to go.
author: Jay R.

description: I eat here at least once a week, usually for breakfast. The baby breakfast burrito and the chilaquiles are the go to dishes for me. Their chorizo and huevos montados plates are great too. This is about the only authentic Mexican food place in the area, unless you're a total ass hat and consider Taco Hell, La Salsa, or Rubio's to be even barely comparable.
author: Gary T.

description: Pass on the burritos, but everything else, espically the house-made salsa is great.
author: Rene D.

description: Bad burritos. There's actually much worse around, so I'll give them two stars, but if you're looking for some good Mexican, go to the taco cart down Spear St. (past Rincon Center).
author: Josh O.

description: I think that this is the only authentic Mexican restaurant near my office and I'm definitely a fan. It gets pretty crowded during lunch time, but I've never had to wait a long time to get seated there with my co-workers. I love how quickly they bring out the food orders too. Whenever we eat there and we're in a hurry, we get in and out quickly - and we leave feeling satisfied!
author: Christine J.

description: Those nuns know how to make a mean enchilada sauce.  I showed those cheese enchiladas who's boss.  Go to Orale Orale and go to town on the cheese enchiladas and I guarantee you you'll be glad you did.
author: Jen S.

description: Nice people and the carnitas burrito I had here was excellent. This place is fast and efficient meant to feed the hungry financial peeps like myself who want to grab a quick lunch.
author: Ericka A.

description: A fine Taquera in the financial district with friendly staff.  The nachos I'd ordered were okay (i.e. your standard fare, nothing amazing)
author: ITesh J.

description: The senior associate who hooked me up with my current job introduced me to Orale Orale, and he couldn't stop raving about this place when we went there for lunch one day.  I can still remember tasting it for the first time and loving it and praising it for days.  Looking back on that lunch, I really was just kissing my boss's ass and lying to myself about how "ehh" it really was.  That was way before I tasted anything in the Mission, and now I sing a much different song.  Orale Orale's tortilla chips would be so much better if they didn't leave them out to get stale.  However, I do like their salsa, which is really spicy.  The Carne Asada Supremo is the only thing I've ordered, which was great the first time but not as great the second time around.  Dude, they use the same shredded cheese as TACO BELL.  Busted!
author: Andrea U.

description:
amazing!!  i love to come here on fridays for the crab enchilada's (fri only).  the line gets long right at noon, so come early to grab a small table.   comfortable from 2-4 people only, this place is tight!  but staff is friendly and works fast.  they even give tortilla chips with their hot salsa (you can ask for mild).    

there are 2 lines (one for table and the other for takeout).  be sure you ask the last person in line to ensure you're in the right one. 

i've been here for years, and their quality of food and demand is still excellent!
author: Ju D.

description: This place serves a completely unimaginative vegetarian burrito. The salsa is uninspiring, the filling is bland. It is not supremo as the naming suggests. I can't speak to the other, meat based offerings. Why would I?
author: Milk and Cheese ..

description: I was surfing yelp for decent Mexican food establishments close to my office and found Orale, Orale. 5 stars for proximity to work. (I can see it out my window now.) I'm currently right in the middle of my carne asade supremo burrito without sour cream and it is pretty tasty. The meat is flavorful and has a nice crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside texture. The salsa is fresh and the rice is run of the mill. I recommend this place over Rubio's (eek) anyday. They didn't give me chips to go though which was a little disapointing, but still a solid 4-star lunch.
author: Nicole P.

description: As I type I'm enjoying a delicious chicken quesadilla!  Since transferring to the city, I've been missing the on-site cafe at my previous office that offered basic taqueria entrees on the daily lunch menu...then I was recommended to check this place out.  Granted this is the first time I've tried this place, I'm pleased that I have and even more pleased that it's just up the street from work!  I'm a little saddened to see that their fish tacos haven't gotten good reviews, as I was hoping to find another place to fill those cravings (Mijita's is good...yet too small, especially for the price).  Anyway, back to the quesadilla.  Ironically it's under their appetizers but I think the portion is perfect for an individual serving.  The tortilla was nice and crisp, the chicken was tender and guacamole and sour cream are included on the side (most places will charge extra for this!)  Waiting for my order I noticed others dining in enjoying massive burritos and tasty looking chimichangas...I will definitely have to try those next time.  There was only one person ahead of me and after placing my order, I was out of there in no time--though I did go around 1:00, after the lunch rush.  Okay, just finished my quesadilla and I'm stuffed!
author: Tess E.

description: cheap mexican but the service is really bad.
author: Patrick L.

description: Ideal for a Friday lunch spot...I'm not sure it's quite worth the crazy wait, so be sure to go early!  The enchaladas (both chicken and crab) are quite tasty, but I thought my beef taco was very Ortega-tasting.  The salsa is definitely a highlight...and HOT!  OWE!
author: Sarah D.

description: Great sit-down Mexican food.  Brave the lines and grab a table and a beer, as tables turn over quickly.  Or jump in line and grab and go with their takeout.  Always nice staff, great food for the money.
author: Lucas M.

description:
Not bad, closest taco place to the embarcadero next to La Salsa.

Decent Carne Asada burrito's for sure, chips are pretty ghetto and the salsa is just ok. For the area its a pretty solid choice. No fountain soda, you get a paper cup and a can of coke to pour on your own. Get there before 11:30 or be prepared to wait 20 minutes for take out, or call it in first, the line is busy a lot but re-dialing is a hell of a lot better than standing elbow to elbow waiting for your food like I do on the damn 38 every day.
author: Jason B.

description:
Good food found here although it's always pretty packed.  

I've come here for both breakfast and lunch.  In both cases, I was very happy with the food.  I like the seafood burrito because it's big and hearty.  Then again, all of their burritos are hearty.  

Check it out.  One of the better places to eat lunch at downtown.
author: Scott L.

description:
how does this place stay in business?
not clean
not tasty
yes, cheap
but sketchy! one star because I didn't get food poisoning.
author: K. T.

description: I use yelp to feel out  places all the time, however I have never been compelled to review a place until now.  After almost working in the financial district for 4 years and eating at Orale over those 4 years I've come to the conclusion that I only go there to eat the chips and salsa.  I've tried multiple dishes to see what I like and everything is so mediocre.  This morning was the last meal I will ever eat there.  The food is completely flavorless, I always fooled myself because I doused everything in their delicious salsa.  If you like flavorless food and parmesan cheese from the Kraft can, eat at Orale.
author: Mar L.

description: This place is great, for sit down or takeout. Tasty tacos and burritos, superb enchiladas. The lunch rush really packs them in, and they handle the crowd fairly well. And you can call ahead and even when quite busy they will have it ready for you.Good spot if you are near the EC's.
author: Aaron B.

description: Margarita's-to-go, need I say more? The chips, guacamole, and salsa are great. The service is awesome. The margies are always SUPER strong.
author: Jewel N.

description: Great mexican at a great price. I always say to myself, since this restaurant is a good walk from where i work, "hmm maybe I'll take a long lunch today and go to Orale Orale."  But a funny thing happens, it never turns into a long lunch! Their speedy service is phenomenal! Chips, salsa, and drinks right when you are seated and great food shortly follows. the chicken enchiladas are amazing espcially with their special sauce and the rice is a little sweet, just the perfect combination for the spicy salsa. If you are or even if you are not in the FiDi area, this place is a must visit! With the extra time you have, cruise to Crown Books in Embarcadero 1 where every book is $5!
author: Sumant C.

description: Decent.  Food is fast even though they are busy, and the portions are big.  I had the chicken tacos, the bean/cheese burrito, and carne asada burritos there.  Meh.  Bland. Okay.  Better than most Fidi eateries for lunch. But I wouldn't go there for any other reason than a quick, filling lunch.
author: MakeUp M.

description: I love this palce, because I always get taken to lunch here. I've been eating here for over a year now and I cant stop going back. Lets see whats good, EVERYTHING. i have waited an hour for a table but it was SOOOOO worth it. If your in the finacial and want so mexican, stop by you wont be diaponited.
author: Tony P.

description: OMG they have the best shrimp aurora you can taste. The dish is $11 and you get your money's worth, like 8 jumbo shrimp smothered in creamy mushroom sauce. I am always craving this dish you should go try it!
author: Eva L.

description: Yummy. For me this is the place for a nice and strong margarita lunch! I am a fan of the chile verde burrito. It's packed early so prepare to stand in line for lunch.  Nice & friendly staff.  Ask for the margarita's with light ice - if you can speak Spanish (and not butchered but like a native) they might help you out.  ;)  Smallish but I like it that way.
author: Sandra P.

description: This is a top notch burrito place.  They def get the award for the moistest burritos in the city.  Just about anything is good except for the veg burrito.  I like the seafood burrito.  Somewhere between the american style mexican restaurant in the town you grew up in and a dirty authentic taqueria that makes everything taste like lard... in a good way.
author: Kurosh H.

description: Orale Orale has pretty good chips & salsa and, in my opinion, passable, though cheap and greasy, fare otherwise.  However, my group was abused by the owner or perhaps a manager when we were there because one person (out of 5 crowded around a 4-person table) did not want to order an entree - only a drink and to share some appetizers.  The owner or manager came out and said he had to order an entree.  We were put out by that and told this individual that we would order additional drinks that would be more than the cost of an entree.  The individual refused and told us we could leave if we didn't like it. One person in the table said he thought this policy was ridiculous.  So the individual opened the door and told us to leave.  He also physically threatened two of the guests as we were leaving--granted they were griping about the treatment, but still ....  Now in fairness, this happened two years ago and perhaps the staff are not usually like this.  But my opinion of the place has been soured permanently.
author: Nick K.

description: It's lunch time in the financial district and I've got a craving only Orale can fix. I need cheese enchiladas and a flauta, now. Sometimes they make me wait but most of the time I'm able to get in and out in my lunch hour with no problem. Full, happy, and in desperate need of some time on the treadmill.
author: Jessica R.

description: Delicious, cheap, and quick. Just don't go at lunch time and expect it to be quiet or a place where you can relax after your meal.  Great prices on baby burritos.
author: Dominique K.

description: This has to be the closest to (San Diego) Mexican food I've tasted.  You So.Cal folks know what I mean, and know the difference.  It's been awhile since I've been here but the tacos and burritos are pretty good.  The Salsa was most excellent.
author: Robert M.

description: Ordered Chicken Enchiladas Verdes - Beans are horrible, no flavor.  Rice is extremely lackluster for Spanish Rice, about the same quality you would get for school lunch from the cafeteria. Main dish, edible but not great.
author: Gena O.

description: Fast line, fast service, excellent food.  great to get out of the office but also get you back to work quickly.
author: Scott H.

description: The best Original Chimichanga I have EVER had! They are addicting; if you haven't tried one yet you are in for a surprise. Their salsa is fresh and made on the spot none of that canned salsa stuff you find at El Torito or Rubios. Why go commercial when you can have it home made fresh? You can pay a commercial price and put a hole in your pocket or go to Orale Orale support your local small business and keep some cash.
author: T P.

description: Great enchiladas, chips, and salsa! This place is affordable and an easy wait for a table or take out for lunch in the financial district. The margaritas are strong also!
author: Sarah R.

description: It's no secret SF has some damn good Mexican food.  I've yet to find Mexican food that tastes the way it should, that is, the way my mom's and grandma's tastes, until Orale.  My husband and I frequent this financial district spot about 1 a week.  Our favorite: tostada with beans, no meat (the way tostadas are supposed to be seved).  Don't be put off by the long lines, it moves fast.  Good, quick service.  Excellent food.
author: Janet L.

description:
Have you people lost your mind? Have you no dignity? Are you criminally insane?

These are the questions I ask myself as I see the yuppies pour out the door of this godawful establishment.

The rice is just horrible.  It's like they poured dirty bacon grease on it or something.  The meat is totally bland and flavorless.  There's no legitimate salsa bar.  In short -- a horrible burrito.

Go to Tlaloc or Pancho Villa's instead, as they are all within a few blocks of one another.  Stay away from Orale Orale.
author: Dean A.

description:
I went to Orale Orale for lunch today.  I got the supremo carne asada...the burrito is ok, a bit too much rice and guacamole for my taste...not enough meat or beans.  

I am most unhappy about is no chips and salsa included...what?!   There are better places to get a burrito even if it is the financial district.
author: carrie b.

description:
I always come here for the crab enchiladas (only on fri) or seafood enchiladas. I love the white sauce that comes with it. The rice and beans are tasty too.  Sometiimes I get the chicken burrito supremo which is tasty and pretty big.  The chips and salsa are good.  Service is speedy, great for lunchtime.

Go again? Yes, definitely!
author: J L.

description:
Food is decent. 

I come back for the service.

The guys here are great. 
Fast, humorous, very cool. 

Great lunch spot for financial district. Come in off times though otherwise be prepared to wait.

Enchiladas are great
Burritos are great

Salsa always seems to bug my stomach for some reason. Might be the green onions in it. 

I go here and can regularly get out for under $10 with a full belly and a smile on my face. 

Highly recommended.
author: David L.

description: I stumbled into this place a few years ago durring one of my hunts for a new place to go for lunch, the food is fantastic. My only problem with Orale is I have such a hard time trying to figure out what I'm going to have that day....it's all great !
author: Sheri M.

description:
Don't order takeout from here if you care what menu item you pay for.  I've eaten here several times, and it's been great -- I order the same thing, and it's as basic a burrito as you can get.  The seating service I've had there has been good.  That's the only reason I'm not giving them a 1, because every time I've ordered takeout, they have gotten it wrong *every* time.

The only reason I have kept going back is because I felt like I was doing something wrong; but when I unwrapped my food at my office and it was wrong *again*, I called them to see what the deal was.  The girl who answered couldn't even describe the difference between what I got and what I ordered.  Maybe they're just in too much of a hurry to get your order done to pay attention if they got it done right.  I won't waste my time and money there again.
author: C S.

description: I love Orale!! The food is great and so are the chips and salsa! The service is amazing! I love everyone at Orale Orale!
author: kristina g.

description: best mexican food in the financial district, hands down. everytime i come here i leave wanting more - even when my pants are about to bust open because i stuffed myself. the salsa is awesome. the beans and rice are delicious. i've only had the chicken dishes (my favs being the chicken flautas, and the chicken chimichanga). the chicken is juicey and delicious and moist and the most important thing (to me) is that i have never found any chicken gristle in any of my dishes. if you're looking for good mexican food in the FiDi, i highly recommend this place.
author: James J.

description: get here before 12pm if you plan on eating there as the lines get pretty long.  even if you get stuck in their line, they do a good job of keeping the line moving quickly.  they prepare all their dishes quickly, which may not be such a great thing but is still nice especially if you have a 1pm meeting.  their burritos (get it slathered w/ enchilada sauce) are pretty damn tasty and i love the enchiladas verde.  very good carne asada too!  i also experienced mexican coke here for the first time and for those of you who are not in the know, the difference is that US coke uses high fructose corn syrup whereas mexican coke uses real cane sugar, what a concept!
author: Swarup B.

description: Love the food here. Typically not a big fan of Mexican, but this place is different.
author: J W.

description: decent, but nothing to write home about. not for the health conscious as there are no choices when it comes to tortilla types or beans. (flour and refried is what you're gonna get). it might look like a tacqueria from the outside, but don't be fooled -- almost the entire menu is made up of plates.
author: Jon N.

description: I'm a big fan of their chicken chimichanga.  I order it every time I go there.  Their chips and salsa are great too.  Can never get enough!
author: Nick H.

description: this great lunch spot was just introduced to me today - thanks jeff!  the salsa on the table was fresh and spicy like i like, and the chicken tostada salad was great, just the right mix of ingredients and flavors.  also, the service is really fast so there is plenty of time to sit and eat and still stick to a reasonable lunch break.  clearly i'll need to investigate those margaritas-to-go on my next visit ...
author: ali l.

description: BEST CHIPS & SALSA EVER! I eat here like 3 days a week, I know ridiculous but it's close to work and like I said chips & salsa are bomb!! so yes, yum yum. I think everything is good. I get the chicken enchiladas a lot. ORALE! ORALE!
author: Brittany L.

description: I'm giving them one star because Yelp won't allow me to give them zero stars. I had eaten here a couple of times over the last few years and the food was always okay. Nothing spectacular, but not terrible. Forward to the present. I ate lunch here last Friday.  I had the chicken fajitas and a handful of chips with salsa (the salsa is good).  I have been sick since then. It is now Monday and I'm just starting to feel better. Here are the facts: I started to feel uneasy Friday evening and knew something wasn't right. Friday night, I was achy and feverish and barely slept. At 2 PM on Saturday (approximately 24 hours later), I made the first  of at least 10 - 15 unpleasant trips to the bathroom (over the course of Saturday and the next day).  I barely slept Saturday night night because I was getting up every two hours and felt horrible. This continued on Sunday and it is now Monday. My stomach is improving, but is still not 100% normal and I am still fatigued. I can assure you that I will never eat at this restaurant again, and it has nothing to do with the service as the people that work there actually nice and the service is decent.  I can't say with 100% certainty that it was from eating at this restaurant, but I didn't eat breakfast that day, the preceding day I had eaten  cereal, a banana, a Balance bar, and bread with peanut butter.  You make the call.
author: Boss H.

description: great place for a some serious heart burn.  When I use to work there it was the place to go for mexican and lines out the door.  It's wise to go early to beat the crowd.
author: Chase H.

description: So I've been here a few times and I always found it to be expensive and mediocre. Last time was the last straw - no more. Ordered the chile relleno. It was horrible. Tiny peppers basically just stuffed with cheese and surround by massive amounts of soggy breading. The chile itself was literally a couple of bites. Disgusting.
author: Pablo P.

description: I was floored by the disinterested staff, mediocre food, and by far one of the worst margaritas I have had anywhere. I hope that I caught them on a bad day but their rice was an uncomfortable yellow and there was parmesan cheese on their enchiladas. Ehhhh....Margarita was pricey too and tasted like oversalted Gatorade. It was like being kickde when I was already down.
author: Pizz D.

description: there is a serious shortage of good lunch spots on the embarcadero, so when i'm feeling naughty, i go to the best one:  ORALE ORALE.  their burritos rival el buen sabor's, but they aren't wrapped as nicely.  doesn't matter, they are delicious.  i also love the chicken soft tacos.  the only drawback is the food coma i go into after eating here...it makes for an unproductive afternoon.
author: Natalie H.

description: the baby burrito is awesome and CHEAP!!!! you really can't go wrong with $3.25 and it's the perfect size!!
author: Z A.

description: I went to this placed based on it's Yelp reviews and I was seriously disappointed.  I got the fish supreme burrito and it was one of the most disgusting things I've ever eaten.  If it wasn't so freaking expensive I would have thrown it away and gotten another lunch.  There was almost no seafood in the burrito and calling those overcooked shriveled things prawns and scallops is a joke.  The wet sauce it comes in tastes like vomit and probably has a billion calories.
author: D G.

description: OMG I'm biting into this Vegetarian Supremo burrito for $5.25 and it is SO GOOD.  So fresh.  I love how the guacamole is price-included.  Found a new lunch spot!
author: S M.

description: I love everything here - especially their breakfast.  Huevos con Papas with rice and beans, tortillas, and salsa for $5.99.  I could never finish the whole thing and usually share with someone.  It sucks they don't open on weekends though.  I usually come here when I'm working in the city.  They do get super crowded during the lunch.  Then again, it is a really small restaurant.
author: Maryanne D.

description: fantastic restaurant!! for the price it was unbeatable. we had a large wheelchair scooter with us, and not only were they very accommodating and immediately created space for us, we had great service and great food at a fantastic price! definitely a do again!
author: jennie k.

description:
been eating here for about 8 years.  the food is authentic, and quickly prepared.  they have what I consider the best salsa in town, and it's nice and hot as it should be.  their chips are also freshly made in house from tortillas -if you stop by for a breakfast burrito, you'll see them being made in the mornings.
the waiters are all super cools dudes and it's family run, so they take care of you like their own.

i hightly recommend the carne asada and pollo asada supremo burriotos -can't go wrong with either, and with black beans and no rice, they actually have a healthier tilt to a gut bombs you get in the mission.  expect to pay a bit more here than other mexican restaurants as they have premium real estate and are only open during weekdays.    love live orale orale -it's the chronic.
author: G. H.

description: just got a breakfast burritto with chorizo from Orale, literally 2 minutes ago. It was probably the worst thing I've eaten in about 2 years. Firstly this piece of crap was pre-made with about 1/8 of an egg and absolutely no chorizo. Most the what I ate was a freezing cold tortilla and loads of lettuce. I frickin' hate this place with a passion, but it's the day after Xmas and beggars can't be choosers.
author: Anon Y.

description: haven't been here for a while since i found my 'eatery' at the mission district. the seafood burrito is best (and gigantic).
author: Suki S.

description:
it's ok, not great just ok.  our office tends to get breakfast here on rare occasions.  i tend to get chilequiles verdes.  i tried the breakfast burrito, but i wasn't impressed.  the chlequiles actually have taste.

the food is ok; it fills you up.  but i always get mad after ordering here because i feel the prices are too high.
author: Lito S.

description: While I would like to write a bad review to make the line shorter at Orale, I am not able to do so.  This is my favorite mexican food in downtown SF, with Pancho Villa coming in a close second.  The service is speedy and friendly, their carne asada and chicken burritos are full of flavor, and the salsa is top notch.  My friends and I try to make it here for lunch every week.
author: Chris W G.

description: Food quality isn't the most amazing I've ever had but it is tasty. Most importantly, Orale Orale is FAST. I've had many a weekday lunch there and they've got their food prep down to a science. Good value for your dollar. Very friendly staff as well. Well worth a visit - I've never left there disappointed.
author: Myles Y.

description: I've only tried  a chicken burrito, but that was enough for me.  The burrito was wrapped really loosely (compared to burritos I've had from other Mexican places and taco trucks in SF), which made it difficult to eat unless it was eaten off of a plate with a knife and fork, and really defeats the purpose of getting a burrito to go.  Filling was not that memorable either.
author: M W.

description: super yummy mexican food! love the tacos.  lines are really long during lunch.
author: chini l.
